De som är med på vår resa idag har en trygg anställning MEN sätter sin egen lön och bestämmer själva över sina förmåner så som pension, utbildning, arbetstid och tjänstebil.
   

  

 Våra kunder finns bland annat inom detaljhandel, bank/finans/försäkring, energi, transport och offentlig sektor. De flesta av våra kunder är i Stockholmsregionen men vi har även kunder i andra delar av landet.
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket och semestertider dröjer återkoppling längre än vanligt.

title: Technical Project Leader, Cummins Scania XPI Engineering
description:
For the last 20 years, Scania has partnered with Cummins Engine Company in a joint venture to develop and manufacture common rail fuel systems. Today this fuel system, known as XPI, is used extensively on both Scania and Cummins engine platforms. The main product development site for the high-pressure pump and fuel injectors used in the XPI system is located at Cummins Fuel Systems in Columbus, USA and since 2017 a product development and product support office has been established at Scania in Södertälje to allow for a closer cooperation with current and future European customers and suppliers. Being located at Scania has further developed our collaboration with the Scania R&D organization, allowing us to jointly develop and tailor future fuel systems for customers within the Traton organization. We operate with a large degree of autonomy and have responsibility for an exciting portfolio of fuel system development projects.
   

  

 The Södertälje office has grown both in personnel and capability over the last few years and we are at the moment roughly 30 employees, working in 3 separate groups. We are now looking to add a Technical Project Leader to the System Performance and Integration team (DIXP).
   

  

**Your role**
 As a Technical Project Leader, you will be responsible for the technical content in a product development program. This involves leading and coordinating the activities needed to take a design from proof-of-concept to a reliable product in a customer application. You will manage technical risk /quality trade-offs and their impact on cost and delivery. You will negotiate requirements with the customer as well as interact with other stakeholders in the development program, such as preferred partner suppliers, manufacturing, purchasing and marketing teams.
   

  

 You will have frequent contact with our colleagues in Columbus, USA, where several of the core functions in the program team are located. Hence developing a good working relationship with your peers within the global Cummins and Scania fuel systems organizations will be an essential part of the role. The work involves some travel to the USA for collaboration, project reviews and training.
   

  

 Since we are a small office in Södertälje, we ask and offer help where needed, and depending on your interest and experience, you might be given other assignments to support you colleagues.
   

  

**Your profile**
 We are looking for someone who loves being in the technical epicentre during a product development program. You communicate in a clear way and ensure that information is transparent and expectations are understood by all stakeholders. You focus on goals and results, while considering the larger perspective and the long-term significance of your decisions. Helping a team member, or reaching out for help comes naturally to you, even though it might be slightly outside your formal role as a Technical Project Leader. You understand the importance of creating good relations both locally and globally.
   

  

  

* You have a bachelor’s or master’s degree in mechanical engineering or equivalent.
* You have at least 5 years of previous experience from product development, preferably within engine or fuel system development with a focus on system- and/or requirement engineering.
* Previous experience as a Project Leader and knowledge of project management tools is a merit.


 Since we work in a truly global environment with daily contact and collaboration with colleagues in the USA and other Cummins teams located worldwide, excellent English communication skills are required.
   

  

**We offer**
 If you are looking for an opportunity to be part of a unique collaboration within a global organization, where we focus on teamwork, our people and developing world class products for our customers – this is your chance. We offer an open climate, where everyone’s contribution is appreciated and encouraged. Even though we are a relatively small organization, we have a lot of experience and wide-reaching responsibilities. We have substantial freedom and autonomy to decide how we get things done and are committed to delivering excellence in everything we do.
   

  

**Further information**
 Please contact Niclas Wiker (Manager DIXP) on 070 081 3030 for further information.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application shall contain CV, personal letter and relevant certificates. Please apply through our website as soon as possible but no later than 2024-09-04.
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application!

title: IT Governance Specialist | SEB Kort
description:
Make a difference! Be a part of the IT Governance team at SEB Kort.
   

  

 SEB is more than just a bank with an IT function. We are a progressive tech company powered by innovation and fueled by collaboration. From COBOL to AI and everything in between, we offer you an impressive tech stack and several technology paths. Together we're innovating for a sustainable society and building the tech arena of the future, a welcoming space for everyone. Are you ready to take on a new challenge? If so, you'll be interested in this opportunity!
   

  

 SEB Kort is a fully owned subsidiary of SEB operating in Finland, Sweden, Denmark and Norway. SEB Kort has a leading market position in corporate cards, payment solutions and travel administration in the Nordic countries. We are the second largest issuer of Mastercard corporate cards in Europe.
   

  

 The team working with IT Governance consist of highly competent and service minded people and is a critical function within SEB Kort.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As an IT Governance Specialist, you’ll be instrumental in applying guidelines and strategies, following procedures, and addressing identified problems to ensure our IT Governance processes adhere to industry norms and support our business objective.
   

  

 Together with the colleagues you will work operationally and strategically to support both Tech and Business to establish and ensuring adherence to the IT Governance framework. At the same time, you will be nurturing the culture around IT Governance in our organization.
   

  

 Great communication with your team and stakeholders will be a key factor for success in this role.
   

  

**To thrive in this role, we believe you have**
* Technical knowledge in order to understand SEB Kort’s platforms, applications and business processes.
* A positive, proactive attitude and willingness to learn continuously.
* Great attention to details and strong critical thinking.
* A proven record of excellent collaboration and communication skills.
* Fluency in a Nordic language and English.
* Degree in IT or similar/gained knowledge from work experience.


**It is beneficial if you also have:**
* Worked with IT Governance frameworks/standards and their implementation.
* Experience within Identity and Access management area.
* Knowledge about AD, ACF2/RACF.


**What We Offer**
* Friendly and welcoming culture.
* Exciting, cutting-edge work in a global innovative company.
* Extensive training and learning opportunities.
* Mobility within a large global company.
* Hybrid working arrangement and flexible work schedule.


 Ready to take the next step on your career journey?
   

  

 Do you want to be part of SEB?
   

  

 Welcome to our inclusive culture, where our shared values inspire and uplift our team. We celebrate diversity and strive to ensure every employee feels seen, heard, and valued.
   

  

 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 1st of September 2024. If you have questions about the position, please contact Åsa Bergman at asa.bergman@seb.se
   

  

 Learn more about working at SEB here: www.sebgroup.com/techcareers
   

  

 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

title: Junior Accountant
description:
Are you a newly graduated or have a few years of experience in Accounting?
   

  

 Do you want to work in a motivating environment with lots of flexibility and make a difference for local and foreign companies operating in Sweden?
   

  

 TMF Group are currently looking for a Junior Accountant to join our growing team in Stockholm!
   

  

**About TMF Group**
 TMF Group is a leading provider of critical administrative services, helping clients invest and operate safely around the world. Our 11,000 experts and 125 offices in 87 jurisdictions worldwide serve corporates, financial institutions, asset managers, private clients, and family offices, providing the combination of accounting, tax, payroll, fund administration, compliance, and entity management services essential to global business success.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As an Accounting & Tax Junior Accountant you will assist colleagues with daily tasks to manage a portfolio of both local and international clients in our Accounting and Tax department in Stockholm.
   

  

 You will be part of a supportive team and work in accordance with local Accounting and Tax legislation and in line with internal client’s regulations, as well in compliance with all internal procedures and standards.
   

  

 We are offering learning opportunities to support your career growth - TMF Business Academy will be at your disposal. You will collaborate with more senior colleagues in a motivating work environment with lots of flexibility, freedom, and personal responsibility with direct contact to management and international exchange.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
 In this role, you will work accounting, such as but not limited to;
   

  

* Book-keeping of all types of accounting vouches.
* Tax administration and registrations including VAT administration and reporting in some cases.
* Accruals, reconciliation and documentation.
* Ensure that TMF Compliance procedures are complied within a timely manner


**Key Requirements**
* Master/bachelor's degree in business administration or any other specialized in accounting
* Newly graduated or few years of practical experience in a similar position
* Understanding of commercial and customer-oriented work
* Ability to work independently and hands-on approach
* Clear, concise, and pro-active communication skills
* Strong analytical and organizational skills
* Fluent in Swedish and English with excellent written and verbal communication skills.


 Welcome with your application, the selection is ongoing.
   

  

**What is in it for you?**
**Pathway for career development**
* Work with colleagues and clients around the world on interesting and challenging work.
* We provide internal career opportunities so you can take your career further within TMF
* Continuous development is supported through global learning opportunities from the TMF Business Academy


**Making an impact**
* You’ll be helping us to make the world a simpler place to do business for our clients
* Through our corporate social responsibility program, you’ll also be making a difference in the communities where we work


**A supportive environment**
* Strong feedback culture to help build an engaging workplace
* Our inclusive work environment allows you to work from our offices around the world, as well as from home, helping you find the right work-life balance to perform at your best.


**Applications close:** 
 18 Sep 2024 W. Europe Daylight Time
   

  

 For further information, and to apply, please visit our website via the “Apply” button below.

title: Supply Chain Planner to international company!
description:
Are you a strategic planner with a passion for logistics? We are now looking for a Supply Chain Planner who wants to take the opportunity to become a key player in a global organization and develop with them. The start for this position is immediately - welcome with your application!
 


 Apply here!
 
  

**City :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Job Category :**
 Warehousing / Logistics
 



  

**Extent :**
 Full time, time-limited assignment of 4 months
 



  

**Start date :**
 ASAP
 



  

**Type of work :**
 Staffing
   




**About the role**

 As a Supply Chain Planner, your main responsibility is to plan, coordinate, and optimize our packed goods operations at our clients European hub. You will ensure cost-effectiveness and high customer service by managing production planning for drums and IBCs, participating in improvement projects, and assisting the Head of Supply Chain Operations with cost follow-up and invoice management. Additionally, you will handle stock reconciliation and maintain statistical reporting databases. You will also play an active role in matching supply and demand within the NSP Supply Chain Department along with other stakeholders.
 


  


 On a personal level we are seeking for applicants who lives the companies values of dedication, cooperation and proactivity. The candidate has a good basic understanding of logistics and planning, is structured, positive, service minded, resilient, open to changes, flexible and has good social, influencing and diplomatic skills.
 


  


  

**You are offered**



  

  
* A challenging position in an international setting and a highly motivated team.
  
* The opportunity of making an impact and work closely with dedicated colleagues around the world.
  
* The opportunity to develop within Supply Chain Management.
  

  


**We are looking for**
  
* Academic degree, preferably in logistics and/or economics.
  
* Operational background experience. 2+ years of work experience in logistics or the process industry, particularly within the chemical sector or any other company handling bulk liquids, is considered a valuable merit.
  
* Fluent in english. Knowledge in the Swedish or Dutch language is a valuable merit.
  
* Solid knowledge in IT and Microsoft Office applications, especially Excel
  


  


  

**To succeed in the role, your personal skills are:**



  

  
* Structured
  
* Positive and service minded
  
* Good communication, diplomatic and social skills
  
* Self-sufficient
  


  

  

**Our recruitment process**
  


 This recruitment process is handled by Academic Work and it is our client’s wish that all questions regarding the position is directed to Academic Work.
 


  


 Our selection process is continuous and the advert may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have moved forward to the next phase. The process includes two tests: one personality test and one cognitive test. The tests are tools to find the right talent for the right position, to enable equality, diversity, and a fair process.
   




**Become a part of Academic Work**

 When you apply to this job, you are becoming one of many consultants at Academic Work. This means that not only will you gain fantastic benefits, but also a team of consultant managers to support you through your career with us.
 


 Read more about Academic Work

 Molly Rytter or a colleague in the recruitment team will gladly answer you on stv5@academicwork.se Please specify advert-ID in your email: 15105859

title: Business Analyst within Card Simplification Programme to big bank!
description:
Join a pioneering Card Simplification Programme (CSP) and drive the future of card payments across the Nordics. We're seeking a seasoned Business Analyst with deep expertise in card domains to harmonize product services and streamline operations. Welcome with your application!
 


 Apply here!
 
  

**City :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Job Category :**
 IT
 



  

**Extent :**
 Full time
 



  

**Start date :**
 September
 



  

**Type of work :**
 Staffing
   




**About the role**

 As a Senior Business Analyst within the Nordic Product Harmonization team, you will lead investigations and resolve discrepancies across card product offerings in the Nordic region. You'll collaborate closely with stakeholders to define and document business requirements, ensuring alignment with strategic objectives. This role offers an opportunity to influence the next generation of card management solutions, enhancing efficiency and customer experience.

title: Business Analyst in Transaction Monitoring to Financial Crime Prevention | SEB, Stockholm
description:
SEB is a leading Nordic financial services group headquartered in Sweden and with presence in 20 countries worldwide. As a leading Scandinavian bank, we offer financial advice and a wide range of financial services with strong focus on corporate and investment banking.
   

  

 The recently established Financial Crime Prevention (FCP) function will further accelerate SEBs deployment of financial crime prevention capabilities to continuously meet regulatory expectations and to become a leader in fighting financial crime.
   

  

 The FCP Transaction Monitoring Technology and Investigation Platforms unit is now looking for a driven and proactive Business Analyst to contribute to the business-driven development by taking an active part in going from idea to implementation of processes and tools.
   

  

**About the role:**
 As a Business Analyst at SEB, you'll be part of an inclusive team of professional and engaged colleagues. You'll have the opportunity to work in a dynamic and international environment in close collaboration with development organisations (Tribes). You will be responsible for identifying business requirements, liaising with stakeholders, conducting analysis and together with the team ensuring that our platform solutions align with our strategic goals. Your knowledge and excellent communication skills are critical in bridging the gap between our business objectives and technological capabilities. By collaborating and networking with other internal teams within FCP and Technology, you'll also have room to explore other business areas and grow your skills further.
   

  

**To thrive in this role, we believe you have:**
* Academic degree in Finance, Business or a relevant field;
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to think critically and strategically;
* Ability to manage multiple priorities and work effectively in a fast-paced environment;
* Strong interpersonal skills to interact effectively with both business and technical stakeholders;
* Great communication skills and fluency in English;


**What we offer:**
* International opportunities and working environment
* Long-term stability
* Training and learning opportunities
* Remote working possibilities and flexible work schedule


**Do you want to be a part of SEB?**
 Welcome to our inclusive culture, where our shared values inspire and uplift our team. We celebrate diversity and strive to ensure every employee feels seen, heard, and valued.
   

  

 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than Tuesday the 3rd of September 2024. If you have questions about the position, please contact helena.lundin@seb.se or Olga Wohlfahrt, olga.wohlfahrt@seb.se
   

  

**Learn more about working at SEB here:** 
 www.sebgroup.com/career

title: Senior Technical Consultant
description:
Our mission is to provide innovative services critical to society, unlocking a cleaner, better and more profitable future. Working towards this goal, Volue has become a leading technology supplier and enabler of the green transition, helping energy companies simplify and optimize everyday operations.
 



  





 Volue Smart Energy department is driving the future of Energy Systems around the world. We believe that with our products we can make the change for energy producers and traders. With decades of experience from Nordic Energy Model, Volue is now expanding to new worldwide markets. We want you to help us make the difference!
 



  





 We are now looking for a Technical Operations Consultant who can help to continuously improve Volue’s ability to provide value to customers in line with the Volue mission. In order to achieve this, you will be working together with Project Managers and Consultants within ongoing and future delivery projects - gathering the feedback for product teams.
 



  





**What you will be doing to make a difference:** 




  




* Work in a team that assures quality of delivery of various Volue products – for our current and new customers.
* Deploy, update and configure applications based on provided documentation.
* Introduce deployment and monitoring of scripts and tools – we want to make our processes smooth, innovative and fast.
* Handle (sometimes complex) systems/business applications- we want to make deliveries and systems work uninterruptedly!
* Be ready for challenges - understanding -> defining -> delivering - we believe in ownership!
* Constantly improve - we believe you must grow together with our products!
* Collaborate with people - we are driving future success of Volue!



  





**What you need to succeed:** 




  




* 3-5 years of working as Operations/Delivery/Integration/System Engineer
* Knowledge of scripting (PowerShell, batch, etc.)
* Knowledge of SQL (any) language
* General understanding of IT Systems
 **,** 
 Databases, Networking
* Know how to operate on Remote Systems – within customer’s environment
* General understanding of software programming (nice to have) – in order to help our product teams
* Knowledge of how to utilize and work within an international team
* Any proven delivery example (show-up), IT certificate, know-how will be a plus
* Effective problem-solving skills
* Motivation to develop and grow with us!



  





**Reasons to join Volue team and what we offer:** 




  




* Large degree of influence in shaping & developing the role further
* Great colleagues in one of Europe’s most exciting green tech companies with innovative and international work environment
* Flexible working hours & competitive compensation package



  





 We are looking to hire for Volue office in Stockholm.
 



 In Volue, we cherish each employee’s competence, ideas and personality. Let your skills and talent be a part of our team – and let us leave our mark on the world together!
 



  





  





**Company Culture** 




 In Volue, we believe that in order to be a successful company, we need to bring everyone to the table.
 



 We look at diversity as a competitive advantage. A diverse workforce enables better decision-making and creates more value. By inclusion, we refer to the sense of belonging and being part of a community at work. We want the people of Volue to feel welcome, valued and not least encouraged to bring their whole, unique selves to work.
 



 Volue is about people. From staff to client, people are at the center of all our operations, and we always strive for a flat structure where everyone feels included, appreciated and recognized for their individual efforts. Or as we call it "ONE Volue". We hire talented individuals, regardless of gender, race, ethnicity, ancestry, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, cultural background or religious beliefs.

title: Försäkringshandläggare/administratör inom liv-/försäkringsbranschen
description:
Beskrivning
   

  

 I och med pågående kompetensväxling hos vår klient söker vi en försäkringshandläggare som åtar sig olika arbetsuppgifter för att frigöra tid för kompetensutveckling samt för att bidra i pågående digitaliseringsarbete. Du kommer utföra olika uppgifter i verksamheten med administration inom utbetalning av liv och pension med dess kringliggande arbetsuppgifter. Arbetsuppgifterna kan variera över tid men är inom ramen för utbetalningsgruppens ansvarsområde.
   

  

 Arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 I rollen som försäkringshandläggare kommer du att arbeta med administration av utbetalningar av försäkringar inom liv och pension. Handläggning sker i olika system och innefattar uppskjutningar, förtida uttag, återköp och utbetalning. Kringliggande arbetsuppgifter bestående av att hantera post och förfrågningar, rättningar, backningar och returer etc, sådant som hör utbetalningar till. Vi bemannar även en telefonislinga där vi ger support till Länsförsäkringsbolagen, Mäklarservice, Kundservice och indirekt till slutkund. Då vi står i en transformation att successivt byta system kan det även uppstå städjobb i systemen av olika slag. Arbetet sker både självständigt och i team som arbetar lean/agilt.
   

  

 Kvalifikationer
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har:
   

  

* Kompetens och erfarenhet inom liv och pension
* Erfarenhet av administration i liv -och pensionsystem
* Erfarenhet av handläggning och administration.
* Van att läsa komplexa texter, arbeta självständigt och har lätt för att lära.
* Har lätt för att se samband och helhet.
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska.


 Meriterande är även kompetens inom bokföring
   

  

 Villkor
   

  

 Tjänsten är på heltid där du blir anställd av Q och arbetar på uppdrag hos vår klient. Startdatum: 2024-10-01, slutdatum: 2025-09-30. Möjlighet att arbeta på distans 25% av tiden finns.
   

  

 Q har kollektivavtal och är medlem i branschorganisationen Almega samt i Svenskt Näringsliv. Företaget erbjuder interims- och rekryteringslösningar inom branscherna IT, teknik, administration, ekonomi, industri samt lager/logistik med personallösningar inom olika befattningsnivåer.
   

  

 Anställningsform: särskild visstidsanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: heltid | Ort: Stockholm | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2024/335 | Publicerat: 2024-08-20 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2024-08-23

title: Senior Director of Product Management, 2 Hour Learning (Remote) - $200,000/year USD
description:
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, 2 Hour Learning. Have you got what it takes?
   

  

 Drive the AI-powered learning revolution at 2 Hour Learning - where student success hinges on your ability to engage, empathize, and innovate.
   

  

 At 2 Hour Learning, we're on a mission to flip the script on traditional education. Our academic ecosystem, powered by cutting-edge AI and learning science, is already enabling students to shatter learning goals in a fraction of the time. But we're just getting started.
   

  

 You'll be the catalyst that takes our AI-driven products to new heights of engagement and efficacy. This role is for educational visionaries ready to roll up their sleeves and get into the trenches with students and staff. You'll engage with users constantly, gathering raw insights to inform each product iteration. No hiding behind focus groups or third-party reports - you'll build trust and rapport directly with the students whose lives your products will transform.
   

  

 But gathering intel is just the start. You'll feed those insights into a non-stop cycle of AI-powered innovation. From generating new features with ChatGPT to automating marketing tasks to maintaining a comprehensive knowledge base, you'll wield AI as your copilot to bring products to life at light speed.
   

  

 You'll also flex your leadership chops, guiding outsourced dev teams to execute on your vision and quality standards. It's full ownership, full accountability, and full potential to make a seismic impact on education. If you're ready to shape the future of learning, one user insight and AI breakthrough at a time, this is the place for you.
   

  

 For more information on 2 Hour Learning, visit our website [https://2hourlearning.com/] and the Future of Education Instagram page [https://www.instagram.com/futureof\_education/]. To see a school built around 2 Hour Learning, check out Alpha [https://alpha.school/].
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Engaging directly with students and staff to gather raw feedback and transform it into actionable product enhancements
* Harnessing generative AI tools to rapidly ideate, prototype, and market new product concepts
* Taking full ownership of the product lifecycle from ideation through launch and iteration, with a relentless focus on student success
* Collaborating with outsourced dev teams to execute on product roadmap and maintain sky-high quality standards
* Immersing yourself in learning science and emerging AI tech to fuel a constant cycle of product innovation


**What You Won’t Be Doing**
* Treating product management as a purely theoretical exercise - you'll be in constant contact with actual students and users
* Waiting for lengthy research cycles to guide product decisions - you'll gather insights directly and leverage AI to move fast
* Passing the buck on product quality or timeline - you'll have full ownership and accountability for outcomes
* Resting on your laurels or settling for incremental improvements - the mandate is to push boundaries and aim for 10x gains


**Senior Director Of Product Management Key Responsibilities**
 Deliver AI-powered educational products and experiences that demonstrably drive unprecedented student engagement, efficacy, and delight.
   

  

**Basic Requirements**
* At least 5 years of product management experience
* Proficiency in leveraging AI tools for key product management tasks, including content creation, user interface optimization, and workflow automation
* Proven ability to gather detailed user feedback through interviews and other methods, analyze data to identify trends and pain points, and translate insights into actionable product improvements
* Demonstrated success managing development teams, ensuring their work aligns with product vision and meets rigorous quality standards
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with a track record of using data to drive product decisions and measurably enhance user satisfaction
* Outstanding written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to provide precise, actionable feedback to cross-functional teams and maintain regular, consistent communication with all stakeholders


**About 2 Hour Learning**
 2hr Learning is powered by AI technology that enables schools to provide personalized, mastery learning to students, enabling them to learn faster than standard school, thereby freeing up the rest of the school day to pursue their passions and interests.
   

  

 There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!
   

  

**Working with Crossover**
 This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $100 USD/hour, which equates to $200,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.
   

  

**What to expect next:**
* You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.
* Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.


**Important!** 
 If you do not receive an email from us:
   

  

* First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.
* Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.
* Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.
* If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.


 Crossover Job Code: LJ-5095-SE-Stockhol-SeniorDirector.005

title: Application Expert
description:
**Arbetsbeskrivning**
 Just nu hjälper vi Vattenfall i Solna att förstärka med ytterligare en application expert med SAP-erfarenhet!
   

  

 Du kommer ingå i det internationella teamet "Authorisation & Compliance team" och ha Financial Systems och Finance Business Support (FBS) som inriktning. Du jobbar mot verksamheten gällande SAP ERA där teamet strävar efter en harmoniserad leverans i alla regioner och ett starkt gränsöverskridande samarbete.
   

  

**Ansvarsområde**
**Dina Främsta Arbetsuppgifter Kommer Vara Att**
 Arbeta med behörighetsadministration över olika regioner för Vattenfall, partners och andra intressenter. Detta innebär att stödja organisationen och hantera ärenden om åtkomstförfrågningar och felsökning i system som t.ex. IAM (Vattenfalls identitetshanteringssystem), SAP (ERP Classic och S4), SRM med flera.
   

  

 Fungera som gränssnitt/SPOC (single point of contact) mot olika affärsområden, IT, andra stödfunktioner och outsourcing-leverantörer, och därmed bidra till goda relationer och bra service gentemot intressenter och kunder.
   

  

 Stödja med övervakning och uppföljning av revisionsfynd, risk och efterlevnad inom teamets och Finance Business Support's ansvarsområde.
   

  

 Samarbeta med riskägare för att minska risker, främst inom det finansiella området, till exempel genom att adressera SoD-risker (Segregation of Duties) och andra kritiska åtkomster.
   

  

 Stödja affärsförändringar, t.ex. etablering av nya bolag, avveckling av bolag, fusioner etc.
   

  

 Delta i utvecklingsprojekt inom FBS eller koncernövergripande/tvärfunktionella projekt och driva uppdrag självständigt.
   

  

 Stödja arbetet mot harmoniserade och standardiserade behörighetskoncept och processer genom projekt och förbättringar. Ge förslag på processförbättringar till processexperter/processpecialister. Sträva efter att automatisera repetitiva och lågvärdesaktiviteter.
   

  

 Stödja med att definiera/beskriva krav/behov inom behörighetshantering, felsökning och utveckling, implementering och test av ändringsförfrågningar.
   

  

 Stödja med utveckling av dokumentation för processer och verktyg för teamet, FBS och andra kunder & intressenter inom Vattenfall.
   

  

 Utföra tjänster med hög kvalitet och i rätt tid enligt gemensamma processer, riktlinjer och policys.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
 För att vara aktuell för den här rollen ska du ha:
   

  

 Fullständiga gymnasiebetyg
   

  

 2-4 års erfarenhet av arbete med SAP
   

  

 Erfarenhet av arbete med behörigheter och identitetshanteringssystem
   

  

 Erfarenhet av arbete med ERP-system
   

  

 Erfarenhet eller kunskap om finansiella processer
   

  

 Erfarenhet av processutveckling och projektarbete
   

  

 Flytande i svenska och engelska (både muntligt och skriftligt)
   

  

 Meriterande: relevant universitetsexamen (t.ex. inom företagsekonomi, redovisning, controlling) eller annan likvärdig utbildning.

title: Global Markets Sales and Trading Off-Cycle 2025 Analyst - Stockholm
description:
**Global Markets, Sales and Trading Off-cycle Analyst**
 Stockholm, Sweden
   

  

**About Us**
 At Bank of America, we are guided by a common purpose to help make financial lives better through the power of every connection. Responsible Growth is how we run our company and how we deliver for our clients, teammates, communities, and shareholders every day.
   

  

 One of the keys to driving Responsible Growth is being a great place to work for our teammates around the world. We are devoted to being a diverse and inclusive workplace for everyone. We hire individuals with a broad range of backgrounds and experiences and invest heavily in our teammates and their families by offering competitive benefits to support their physical, emotional, and financial well-being.
   

  

 Bank of America believes both in the importance of working together and offering flexibility to our employees. We use a multi-faceted approach for flexibility, depending on the various roles in our organisation.
   

  

 Working at Bank of America will give you a great career with opportunities to learn, grow and make an impact, along with the power to make a difference. Join us!
   

  

**The Team**
 Our Global Markets Off-cycle Analyst programme gives our interns maximum exposure to the various products within Sales and Trading.
   

  

**Programme Overview**
 Our Global Markets Off Cycle Analyst programme is typically 3-6 months and gives our interns intensive exposure to a single Sales and Trading desk. Interns will work in an exciting and fast paced environment fully supported by their manager, buddy, mentor, and HR.
   

  

**Training and Development**
 Your training and development is our top priority with extensive formal training offered at the start of the programme in addition to on the job support, educational speaker events and mentorship throughout.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 As an off-cycle analyst, your key tasks and responsibilities may include but are not limited to:
   

  

**Sales**
* Supporting the sales force in their daily activities
* Gaining exposure to client relationship management
* Preparing marketing material and working on client presentations
* Exploring sales leads through market and company research
* Delivering analytical projects around client profitability and market trends


**Trading**
* Supporting traders in their daily activities
* Shadowing senior members of the team and undertaking mock trading as a hands-on approach to learning the basics of risk management and market making
* Analysing client and market data to help develop and execute trades
* Following and analysing macro and company specific events as they unfold real time and anticipating the upcoming path and outcome.


**Structuring**
* Supporting senior structurers, traders, and salesforce across GM in their daily activities gaining maximum exposure to all of GM’s clients and products. Activities might include preparing a pitchbook for a client meeting or analysing, designing, and marketing a new client solution.
* Gaining front to back exposure of GM transactions, ranging from client relationship management with Sales to risk management and pricing with Trading.
* Be part of the analytical engine of GM and deliver projects around topical themes across various asset classes (Equities, Rates, FX, and Credit) by working with other key business stakeholders such as Quants or Research.
* Following and analysing macro, markets, and industry specific events as they unfold real time and providing solutions to a diverse set of institutional clients.


**Eligibility**
* Candidates are required to be pursuing either an undergraduate or postgraduate degree from an accredited college or university, with a graduation timeframe between January 2025 and June 2026, or recent graduates for roles starting from September 2025
* Achieved minimum of 112 UCAS point (or equivalent) and on track for a minimum 2:1 degree classification (or equivalent)
* Must be available to join the programme anytime from January until December 2025


**What We Are Looking For**
 Essential:
   

  

* You'll need to demonstrate drive, innovation and a genuine interest in the financial markets
* Team-working, leadership and problem-solving skills, plus creativity are key qualities, as is the ability to work in a fast-paced environment, multi-task and interact with a variety of people
* You’ll need to demonstrate accountability and productivity and display analytical and problem-solving skills
* You’ll need to Influence decisions and outcomes through effective communication and interpersonal skills
* You’ll need to promote cooperation and commitment within a team environment to achieve goals and deliverables
* You’ll need to demonstrate integrity and ethics by earning other’s trust and respect through consistent honesty and professionalism in all interactions


 Desired:
   

  

* Programming languages/software abilities
* For certain roles language skills will be advantageous


**Our recruitment process**
 Analyst internship and full-time recruiting takes place on a rolling basis once our applications are open. Assessments often begin before the deadline, so it’s best to submit your application early as this will give you the best chance of being considered for the role.
   

  

 We care deeply about shaping the world of work to be an equal and inclusive one – and that starts with our recruitment process. We know just how important and valuable it is to have a wide range of skills, backgrounds and experiences shaping our work and ideas. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds, and we’re proud to focus on attracting, retaining and developing diverse talent within Bank of America. Together, we aim to mirror the customers, clients and communities we serve.
   

  

 We are an equal opportunities employer, and ensure that no applicant is subject to less favourable treatment on the grounds of gender, gender identity or gender reassignment, marital or civil partner status, race, religion or belief, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origins, age, sexual orientation, being pregnant or on maternity leave, socio-economic background, responsibilities for dependants, physical or mental disability. The Bank selects candidates for interview based on their skills, qualifications and experience.
   

  

**What if I need workplace adjustments?**
 We’re committed to ensuring our online application process provides an equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. If you need a workplace adjustment to search for a job opening, need help completing your application or video interview, please email juniortalentemea@bofa.com and let us know. We will be more than happy to discuss the support you need, and we will respond to your email within two business days.

title: Operativ driftansvarig IT till Svensk Direktreklam
description:
Vill du jobba i en operativ roll där du får arbeta med modernisering, utveckling och förändring i en organisation som är ute på en spännande förändringsresa? Vi söker en erfaren och engagerad individ som vill vara med och driva förändringar samt säkerställa en stabil och effektiv IT-miljö. Välkommen in med din ansökan!
 



  

**Företag :**
 SDR Svensk Direktreklam
 



  

**Plats :**
 Uppsala, Stockholm
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 IT
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Enligt överenskommelse
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Rekrytering
   




**Om tjänsten**

 Som Operativ driftansvarig IT kommer du arbeta mångfacetterat med både operativa och administrativa uppgifter.
   

 Genom att leda, planera och genomföra förändringar inom IT-landskapet kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i att modernisera och anpassa Svensk Direktreklams IT-miljö till de krav som ställs, i nära samarbete med IT-tekniker. Du kommer också att fungera som den primära kontaktpersonen för externa leverantörer och delta i upphandlingar samt omförhandlingar av avtal. Du kommer ha ett nära samarbete med ledningsgruppen och företagets danska IT-organisation. Du kommer också vara arbetsledare till en IT-tekniker där ni tillsammans säkerställer en fungerande IT-miljö inom Svensk Direktreklam .
 


  


 Placering: HK i Uppsala alternativt kontoret i Stockholm Liljeholmen.
 


  


  

**Du erbjuds**



  

  
* Möjlighet att växa och utvecklas inom en framgångsrik och växande koncern
  
* Möjlighet till hybridarbete
  
* Goda anställningsvillkor och förmåner
  

  


**Arbetsuppgifter**
  
* Ansvara och delta operativt i drift, underhåll och utveckling av företagets IT-infrastruktur
  
* Samla in verksamhetens behov på IT miljön
  
* Ansvara för inköp och IT-budget
  
* Vara kontaktyta för alla externa leverantörer samt IT hos organisationens danska ägare
  
* Leda, planera och resursplanera utifrån behov och prioritet
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**
  
* Har tidigare erfarenhet från en liknande roll inom IT och tidigare arbete i en driftsorganisation
  
* Har erfarenhet av arbete i en MIcrosoft baserad miljö, systemhantering, infrastruktur och molntjänster
  
* Besitter en bred teknisk kompetens och förstår vikten av att hålla en IT-miljö stabil och uppdaterad
  
* Har tidigare erfarenhet av leverantörsstyrning och kan planera och genomföra förändringar med skicklighet och effektivitet
  
* Är flytande i svenska både i tal och skrift, samt goda kunskaper i engelska
  


  


 I den här rekryteringsprocessen kommer vi lägga stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper där vi ser att du är prestigelös, förändringsbenägen och ansvarstagande. Du trivs i en kombinerad roll där du både är operativ och ansvarig för att driva frågor och presentera lösningar i forum tillsammans med ledningsgrupp. Därmed besitter du även en stark kommunikationsförmåga. Vidare ser vi att du är en strukturerad person med passion för teknik och förbättringsarbete.
 


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och Svensk Direktreklams önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 


  


 Rekryteringsprocessen ser ut såhär:
 


  

  
* Telefonintervju med Academic Work
  
* Urvalstest - personlighet & kognitiv förmåga
  
* Djupintervju med Academic Work
  
* Intervju med Svensk Direktreklam
  
* Referenstagning + beslut
  


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och annonsen kan därmed komma att tas ned om det är så att vi har gått vidare till urvals- och intervjufas.
   




**SDR Svensk Direktreklam**

 Svensk Direktreklam är Sveriges största privata direktreklamföretag och sysselsätter närmare 400 anställda på 34 franchiseföretag. 5000 deltidsanställda utdelare gör företaget till en av Sveriges största ungdomsarbetsgivare. Företaget har 45 års erfarenhet av direktreklam och distribuerar årligen över en miljard trycksaker till Sveriges konsumenter.
 


  


 Svensk Direktreklam arbetar i hela värdekedjan kring direktreklam: från kampanjmål, målgruppsurval, idé, utformning, tryck och distribution av reklamtrycksaker till uppföljning och mätning av reklamens effekter. Svensk Direktreklam har ambitiösa miljö och hållbarhetsmål och har bedrivit ett gediget miljöarbete sedan år 2000 och är ISO 14001 certifierade.
 


  


 Du kan läsa mer om företaget här!
   




**Bli direktrekryterad till SDR Svensk Direktreklam**

 Detta är en direktrekrytering, vilket betyder att den kandidat som får tjänsten blir direktanställd av kundföretaget. Rekryteringsprocessen hanteras av Academic Work.
   




**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Anna Skogum eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på upp01@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15106220

title: Content & Site Coordinator
description:
**About The Opportunity**
**Do you have a strong creative spark and at least 1 year of experience within content creation? Our E-commerce Performance team at foodora market is seeking a motivated new team member with a passion for storytelling. This is the perfect opportunity at Foodora to take your creative career to the next level with us. What are you waiting for? Apply today!**
**Your mission**
* Develop and publish engaging graphical content and compelling copy for foodora market’s app and website, ensuring a consistent and attractive presentation throughout the customer journey.
* Conduct thorough analysis to optimize search engine visibility and help customers find what they need.
* Continuously evaluate and enhance product recommendations using data-driven insights to create an appealing shopping experience.
* Work closely with the team to understand customer preferences and behaviors, ensuring the best possible shopping experience for groceries at foodora market.
* Take full responsibility for foodora market’s banners and content, ensuring it is visually appealing and maintains coherence throughout all stages of the customer journey.


 We are looking for a true foodorian who thrives in a fast-paced environment and isn’t afraid to push the boundaries. To excel in this role, you’ll need to be both
 **creative** 
 and
 **analytical** 
 with a sharp ability to prioritize tasks effectively. We love to measure success and uncover opportunities for growth, and we hope you share that passion! If you're communicative,
 **energetic,** 
 and
 **driven,** 
 you will shine in this role. As you will be collaborating with various departments, your outstanding
 **communication skills** 
 will be key to achieving great results.
   

  

 Our selection process is continuous and the ad may close before the recruitment process is completed, if we’ve moved forward to the screening or interview phase.
   

  

 Our recruitment process will include the following:
   

  

 📞 Telephone interview - Let’s cover the basics!
   

  

 💡 Psychometric tests via Alva Labs - We use science-based methodology.
   

  

 🤝 First interview - Time to know each other a bit better!
   

  

 💼 Case interview - Do your magic and show us your skills!
   

  

 ✔️ Reference- & background check - Final step before we’ll become colleagues.
   

  

 Start date: October
   

  

**What you need to be successful**
* You have a relevant Bachelor’s degree or Higher Vocational Education.
* At least 1+ years of experience in creating both visual and caption content.
* Proficiency in PhotoShop and Adobe Creative Suite.
* Genuine interest in analyzing and understanding the data your work creates.
* Fluent communication skills in both Swedish and English, verbally and in writing.
* Knowledge of any e-commerce systems is a big plus.


**Who we are**
 ABOUT FOODORA: foodora is a quick commerce and delivery company, present in eight countries in Europe - Austria, Czech, Denmark, Hungary, Finland, Norway, Sweden and Slovakia. With the mission to deliver an amazing, fast and affordable experience, foodora aims to give customers more time to focus on what matters most to them, as well as growing along with their partners, riders and community along the way. foodora is part of Delivery Hero, a pioneer quick commerce company, building the next generation of e-commerce across its operations in over 70 countries across Asia, Europe, Latin America, the Middle East and Africa.
   

  

 For more information, please visit www.foodora.com
   

  

 foodora is part of the Delivery Hero Group, the world’s leading local delivery platform operating in 70+ countries worldwide
   

  

**What's in it for you**
* Wellness allowance topped with the opportunity to participate in many work/life balance initiatives at foodora such as free group training at Sats & reduced price on massage.
* Employee discount at foodora (woho!) and awesome friday breakfasts!
* Occupational pension, incl. premium exemption insurance, accident insurance and life insurance.
* foodora Learning - Monthly learning sessions about different topics, such as the q-commerce industry, negotiation techniques and project management combined with a structured onboarding and inspiring courses within our learning tool Sana
* Great deals at Benify (for e.g. gym membership, e-bikes hotels, audiobooks, streaming services, clothes, kitchen supplies… and so much more!
* Awesome AW’s and (pink) parties!

title: Commercial Manager Tele2 Mobile
description:
*Are you a commercial strategist with a passion for driving growth and innovation in the telecommunications industry? Tele2 is seeking a dynamic Commercial Manager for Tele2 Mobile who is ready to lead and shape our mobile business. If you're ready to make a significant impact, keep reading.*
 At Tele2 B2C (Business to Consumer), we are dedicated to enabling a connected society with unlimited possibilities. We manage Tele2’s and Comviq’s consumer brands, covering a wide range of activities from digitalization, commercial strategies, marketing, sales, and customer service to TV content acquisition and advanced analytics. As we continuously strive to deliver superior solutions for our customers, we guarantee that exciting projects will keep coming your way.
   

  

**About The Job**
 As the Commercial Manager for Tele2 Mobile, you will:
   

  

* Own and maximize the P&L performance of Tele2 Mobile
* Drive revenue growth through innovation in business models and proposition design
* Take overarching responsibility for all P&L impacting initiatives


 Key responsibilities include:
   

  

* Managing P&L, including budgeting, forecasting, and follow-up
* Overseeing pricing for both front-book and back-book
* Steering high-level business priorities
* Developing and breaking down commercial strategies into actionable plans
* Conducting business casing and commercial/financial decision-making
* Innovating and developing new propositions
* Developing, calibrating, and maintaining business models


**Who are you?**
 To thrive and succeed in this role, we believe that you have:
   

  

* Commercial experience within TV, mobile, broadband, or another subscription-based service with a proven track record
* Strong business acumen and an understanding of revenue & cost dynamics in complex businesses
* A history of leading innovation that has generated tangible value for consumers
* The ability to collaborate efficiently in a cross-functional environment


 Preferred qualifications:
   

  

* An interest in tech and telecoms
* High proficiency in quantitative tools such as Microsoft Excel


 We think you are a problem solver and forward thinker, with a keen interest in the latest trends and future challenges. You’re a team player who is business savvy, detail-oriented, and driven to challenge the status quo and improve past performances.

title: Content and Social Media Manager
description:
**Position:** 
 Content & Social Media Manager
 



**Location:** 
 Stockholm
 



**Company:** 
 PWR Group
 



  





**About the Role:** 




  





 PWR Group is on the lookout for a passionate and innovative Content & Social Media Manager to join our team. This hybrid role not only involves managing and elevating our social media presence but also strategically developing content marketing initiatives with a strong focus on growth. If you have a burning passion for challenging algorithms and finding creative ways to maximize organic reach, engagement, and impact, this role is for you. You will be a key player in growing our brand presence organically, building general brand awareness, engaging our audience, and driving the communication objectives of both our company and our valued partners.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 




  




* **Social Media Planning & Execution:**
* Develop, implement, and manage social media communication so it aligns with brand and partner goals.
* Manage community engagement by responding to comments and messages, and fostering a strong, loyal online community.
* Have an understanding of social media metrics to track performance and optimize organic initiatives for maximum impact.
* Build and maintain relationships with influencers, ensuring successful partnerships that amplify brand reach and credibility.



  




* **Content Production & Management:**
* Co-strategize on content direction, target audience segmentation, and engagement tactics.
* Create and curate compelling content across social platforms, including posts, images, videos, infographics and AI-generated content.
* Create and produce diverse content formats such as reels, short films, infographics, ensuring they are engaging.
* Build a versatile content library that offers a wealth of material, ensuring agility and consistency in our messaging. You need to be able to scale your own content production, be creative, and work with fast, efficient content in a dynamic environment.
* Manage content calendar to ensure a steady flow of high-quality content.
* Stay ahead of trends in branded content, storytelling, and social media to keep PWR Group’s content fresh and relevant.
* Use creative content tools and AI to enhance content production, enabling us to stand out more efficiently.



  





**Qualifications:** 




  




* Proven experience in social media management and content marketing.
* Strong understanding of best practices regarding growth and organic communication.
* A strong passion for pushing the boundaries of social media algorithms and staying at the forefront of content trends, including the use of AI.
* Great content creation skills across various formats.
* Have excellent communication skills, with the ability to convey ideas clearly.
* Have experience/interest in sports (extra plus for motorsport)
* Must be a strong multitasker who can manage multiple projects simultaneously without compromising quality.
* Must be self-motivated, with the ability to work independently and take ownership of tasks.
* Must be able to travel in work (Race Weekends and Events)
* Must have driver’s license
* Speak/write Swedish and English fluently



  





**Why Join Us?** 




 You’ll be joining a small but dynamic team where innovation meets passion. At PWR Group, we offer a unique opportunity to gain insight into the exhilarating world of motorsport. Our mission is to continually shape and evolve the industry, and we believe in flexible working hours and a hybrid work environment to support your creativity and work-life balance.
 



  





 The PWR Group is based in Stockholm, Sweden. The business group consists of EPWR, PWR RX, PWR Racing and PWR Management. We're united by our passion for motorsports, and in everything we do, we're committed to making the sport more accessible, entertaining, and sustainable. To read more, please visit our website:
 *www.pwrgroup.se* 




  





**Process & Information** 




 Our selection process begins with a brief introductory call to get to know you and your qualifications better. If successful, you will be invited to an initial interview. Candidates who move forward will then be given a case to complete, followed by a final interview.
 



  





 To apply for this position, please send your application (resume and personal letter) directly to: Jenny Videsparv, Head of Brand and Communication: jenny.videsparv@pwrgroup.se with the subject line:
 **Applicant** 
**Last Name + Content and SoMe Manager** 
 PWR Group. The application deadline is September 13th 2024.

title: Legal Contract Manager, Stockholm
description:
**Responsibilities**
 TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok's global headquarters are in Los Angeles and Singapore, and its offices include New York, London, Dublin, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.
   

  

 Why Join Us
   

 Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible.
   

 Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day.
   

 To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always.
   

 At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve.
   

 Join us.
   

  

 The Team
   

 The Global Legal Team, based in Europe, provides a broad range of commercial legal support to multiple business units within TikTok and its sister apps including TikTok’s advertising sales team and associated marketing, creative, trading and partnership teams.
   

  

 The Contract Manager will be responsible for acting as an intermediary between the Global Legal team and The Global Business Solutions Nordics team (GBS), which is responsible for the revenue growth of the TikTok business, and our teams include Sales, Marketing, Ops, Account Managers, Agency and partnerships, as well as Marketing Science.
   

  

 Responsibilities
   

 - Support GBS with any legal issues they may have in their day-to-day conversations with potential and existing clients (i.e. advertisers and advertising agencies) so as to empower them and help them achieve their ambitions.
   

 - Help GBS understand our contracts (e.g. NDAs, advertising purchase agreements) and policies (e.g. data privacy, code of conduct).
   

 - Provide GBS with regular training sessions on a variety of legal topics.
   

 - Interact with key clients to unblock situations when needed.
   

 - Ensure that GBS is aware and masters the resources, processes and templates which the Legal team makes available;
   

 - Identify gaps and issues, and suggest improvements at all levels.
   

 - Work hand-in-hand with the other contract managers in the region.
   

  

**Qualifications**
 Minimum Requirements
   

 - Bachelors degree in law, or equivalent certification.
   

 - Very good understanding of contract law and data privacy (including GDPR).
   

 - Experience and interest in the advertising and/or the digital industries. - Exceptional organisational skills. Ability to manage and complete multiple projects at the same time, and to keep up with the fast pace of the business.
   

 - Excellent written and communication skills. Ability to explain legal concepts to non-lawyers.
   

 - Proactive, self-starter, solution-oriented, flexible with a strong work ethic.
   

 - Bilingual in English and Swedish in order to communicate effectively with the business and stakeholders.
   

  

 Preferred Requirements
   

 - Experience in drafting and negotiating contracts.
   

 - Experience working with international teams including Legal, Sales, Finance and Product.
   

 - Strong IT skills. At ease with databases, trackers and tools.
   

  

 TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

title: Business Solutions Consultant
description:
At Volue we are realizing the Green Transition. Our mission is to provide innovative services critical to society, unlocking a cleaner, better and more profitable future. Working towards this goal, Volue has become a leading technology supplier and enabler of the green transition, helping energy companies simplify and optimize everyday operations.
 



 We are now looking for a Senior Business Solution Consultant to join our team in Volue who can help us to continuously improve Volue’s ability to provide value to customers in line with the Volue mission. In this area, we deliver a comprehensive suite of decision support tools for power production planning, optimization and trading to energy companies in more than 20 countries.
 



 In this role, you will enable energy companies to use their resources most efficiently by utilizing Volue software solutions. In order to achieve this, you will be working together with other Volue consultants and customers worldwide on our software delivery projects.
 



 Senior Business Solution Consultant role involves frequent and close customer and internal contact (Sales, Product Management, Development, Support) regarding software solutions.
 



 Therefore, we are looking for communicators and explorers, who know their way around technology and energy.
 



  





**What you will be doing to make a difference:** 




  




* Understanding what our customers’ needs, challenges and requirements are.
* Configuring our software according to the customer's needs
* Assessing clients' current processes, systems, and workflows and setting up the customer’s business processes in our tools
* Facilitating integration with the customers’ other IT solutions
* Attending customer meetings and workshops
* Supporting Project Managers and Product Managers on the necessary
* Contributing to closing sales cases by estimating new projects, running demos, giving input to solution design



  





**What you need to succeed:** 




  




* Min. 3+ years of experience within energy sector
* Knowledge about European power markets
* Experience with software implementation and project management
* Ability to build and maintain strong client relationships
* Experience with facilitating workshops tailored to customer needs
* Proactivity and ability to manage own workload and work in the team
* In addition, it would be valuable if you have experience with leading teams, but it is not a must.



  





**Reasons to join Volue team and what we offer:** 




  




* Large degree of influence in shaping and developing the role further
* Exciting position with the newest technology for the energy business
* Great colleagues in one of Europe’s most exciting green tech companies with innovative and international work environment
* Flexible working hours
* Competitive compensation package



  





 In Volue, we cherish each employee’s competence, ideas and personality. Let your skills and talent be a part of our team – and let us leave our mark on the world together!
 



  





**Company Culture** 




  





 In Volue, we believe that in order to be a successful company, we need to bring everyone to the table.
 



 We look at diversity as a competitive advantage. A diverse workforce enables better decision-making and creates more value. By inclusion, we refer to the sense of belonging and being part of a community at work. We want the people of Volue to feel welcome, valued and not least encouraged to bring their whole, unique selves to work.
 



 Volue is about people. From staff to client, people are at the center of all our operations, and we always strive for a flat structure where everyone feels included, appreciated and recognized for their individual efforts. Or as we call it "ONE Volue". We hire talented individuals, regardless of gender, race, ethnicity, ancestry, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, cultural background or religious beliefs.

title: Lösningsarkitekt till Axfood IT i Stockholm!
description:
**Vi på Axfood IT i Stockholm söker en Lösningsarkitekt som vill bidra i utvecklingen av E-handel & Kundprogram på våra kedjor!**
 Som en av dagligvarubranschens största aktörer gör vi inom Axfood stor skillnad i miljontals människors liv – varje dag. Tillsammans vill vi skapa mer livskvalitet för alla vi berör genom våra olika koncept, verksamheter och varumärken. Vi tror på ständig förbättring och utveckling, och på att visa omtanke till omvärlden medan vi förändras. Var med på en resa i en spännande bransch där nytänkande, engagemang och prisvärd, bra och hållbar mat är viktiga ingredienser. Välkommen till Axfoodfamiljen!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig**
* Vara med och bidra till utveckling och förvaltning av Hemköps, Willys, Citygross, Dagab och Snabbgross E-handel & Kundprogram i linje med Axfoods övergripande affärsstrategi.
* Komma in i en spännande period där fler strategiska förflyttningar står för dörren och är högt prioriterade i hela verksamheten.
* En trygg arbetsgivare, stor nog att satsa stort och göra skillnad på riktigt och där du kan växa hos och med oss


**Det här gör du hos oss**
 Som Lösningsarkitekt Arbetar Du Nära Beställarna På Våra Kedjor Och Tillsammans Med Utvecklingsledare, Systemarkitekter Och Systemansvariga. Du Är Med Från Tidig Kravställning, Analys, Design, Utveckling Och Driftsättning. Tillsammans Med Teamet Utmanar Du Gamla Arbetssätt Och Hittar Nya Förbättringsmöjligheter För Att Säkerställa Att Lösningarna Är i Världsklass. Dina Huvudsakliga Ansvarsområden Är
   

  

* Ta fram och se till att vi efterföljer arkitekturella riktlinjer som går i linje med Ax-food ITs strategi.
* Ta fram tekniska lösningsförslag och högnivåestimat i olika projekt och initiativ.
* Delta och vara drivande i arkitekturråd och säkerställa att lösningar är enhetliga.
* Ansvara för plattformens tekniska lösning, stabilitet och förutsättningar, samt driva förändringar inom området.
* Stötta teamen och verksamheten i tekniska och domänrelaterade frågeställningar.


**Ditt team och arbetsplats**
 Axfood har en av matbranschens största IT-avdelningar med drygt 300 medarbetare. Vi ligger i framkant vad gäller digital utveckling och ny teknik inom områden som det digi-tala kundmötet, e-handel och arbetssätt. Som Lösningsarkitekt kommer du att tillhöra avdelningen E-handel & Kundprogram som består av ca 70 personer, anställda och konsulter. Du rapporterar till Jennie Kronander, chef för E-handel & Kundprogram.
   

  

 Vi arbetar enligt en hybrid-policy och träffas ett par gånger i veckan på kontoret vid Torsplan.
   

  

**Axfood IT AB gör bakgrundskontroll vid samtliga rekryteringar.** 
 Läs mer på Axfoods hemsida här: https://www.axfood.se/karriar/din-karriarvag/sa-gar-det-till-nar-du-soker-jobb-hos-oss/.
   

  

**Mer om dig**
 För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har erfarenhet av arkitektarbete, som Lösningsarkitekt eller Tech Lead, och har förståelse för systemutveckling i en agil miljö. Det är värdefullt om du har jobbat med kundnära webb- och app-utveckling, Cloud, SaaS, CI/CD och integ-rationer. Erfarenhet av e-handelslösningar och kundprogram är meriterande.
   

  

 Som person trivs du med att arbeta med andra mot gemensamma mål, och har för-mågan att se både detaljerna och den övergripande strategiska och organisatoriska bil-den. Du är analytisk och drivande vilket gör att du genererar både lösningar och resultat.
   

  

**Så här får vi kontakt**
 I den här rekryteringen har vi valt att samarbeta med Ada Digital som strävar efter en transparent, inkluderande och snabbrörlig rekryteringsupplevelse. Vi vill veta mer om dig och din potential! Du söker tjänsten enkelt och behöver inte bifoga några dokument. Det räcker med en motivering till varför du söker tjänsten och om du saknar CV kan du bifoga din LinkedIn-profil. Följ sedan din ansökan live via vår hemsida. Urvalet sker löpande och tjänsten kan bli tillsatt före sista ansökningsdatum. Är du nyfiken och vill veta mer innan du söker? Hör av dig till ansvarig rekryterare. Vi ser fram emot att få kontakt med dig!

title: Business Development Manager, Commercial Solutions-R-216557
description:
**Our Purpose**
 We work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a culture of inclusion for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results.
   

  

**Title And Summary**
 Business Development Manager, Commercial Solutions
   

  

 Who is Mastercard?
   

  

 Mastercard is a global technology company in the payments industry. Our mission is to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart, and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments, and businesses realize their greatest potential.
   

  

 Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. With connections across more than 210 countries and territories, we are building a sustainable world that unlocks priceless possibilities for all.
   

  

**Overview**
 Mastercard has a vision to build a leadership position as the only truly multi-rail payments technology company and Europe is at the forefront in defining and executing our multi-rail strategy. Commercial payments are a large opportunity for Mastercard in the Nordics and Baltics region. This sole contributor role with a hunter mentality will develop and grow our commercial business in the large market B2B and Travel & Entertainment, supplier payments and embedded finance technology partnerships area.
   

  

 Key accountabilities of the role
   

  

* Direct sales through core business development activities including cold call and direct marketing.
* Prospect, contact, and support contracting with new customers through multiple other engagement channels
* Grow spend volumes & increased revenues by identifying and pursuing direct opportunities with potential new corporate customers, active in the Nordics.
* Execute on leadership established and pre-defined sales strategy and through a segmented approach towards mid and large corporates, and partner pipeline.
* Responsible for rigorous sales pipeline management & new business KPI’s
* Introduce commercial card solutions to the target prospects including


 expense management, virtual cards, business-to-business payments, supplier acceptance & onboarding and business intelligence.
   

  

* Play a key role in conversations with decision makers at new customers.
* Enhance ongoing business development relationships with the industry by


 attending & participating in webinars, and customer trainings in the commercial payments space.
   

  

* This is a sole contributor role


**All About You**
* Hunter mentality with a proven track record of creating, driving and winning new business with mid and large market corporates
* Commercial payments experience and knowledge with 3+ years’ experience in the payments or financial services sector.
* Strong understanding of B2B payment flows, business needs and the purchase to pay process in large organisations.
* Demonstrated success introducing & selling existing and emerging platform based B2B commercial payments solutions as a sole contributer
* A track record of executing against clear sales action plans including forecasting & pipeline management.
* Proven ability to build meaningful, trusting relationships with large and multinational customers.
* Strong collaborator - able to build trusted partnerships both internally and externally.
* Track record in consistently achieving business growth targets as sole contributor.
* Comfortable with roles that require discretion, integrity, and agility


**Experiences And Other Requirements**
* Excellent verbal and written communications skills to articulate solutions and value propositions to senior management stakeholders and customers.
* Ability to work collaboratively and deliver results in a highly cross-functional environment.
* High self-motivation and ability to work autonomously; “can do” attitude;


 strong customer and results orientation.
   

  

* Experience in a SaaS based business development role within payments preferred
* Fluency in English with additional Nordic language highly preferable
* Bachelor’s degree required


**Corporate Security Responsibility**
 All activities involving access to Mastercard assets, information, and networks comes with an inherent risk to the organization and, therefore, it is expected that every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security and must:
   

  

* Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices;
* Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed;
* Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and
* Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines.


 R-216557

title: Manager Trusted Services
description:
Beskrivning av tjänsten
   

  

 Nu söker vi en erfaren ledare till ett kompetent team av IT-specialister inom certifikat- och signeringstjänster på enheten Trusted Services, Business Unit Global Technology Operations (GTO.) Trusted Services ligger i framkant när det gäller den senaste tekniken och utvecklar just nu flera spännande lösningar till bland annat fordonsindustrin. Framöver kommer enheten fortsätta utveckla flera nya teknologier, där du som ledare får möjlighet att bygga vidare på teamets sammansättning och tjänsteutveckling.
   

  

 Tjänsten är placerad i Stockholm där de flesta i teamet är placerade. Du behöver vara beredd att jobba merparten av tiden på kontoret. Resor förekommer i jobbet.
   

  

 Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 Nu söker vi dig som vill leda teamet som består av 20 engagerade medarbetare som känner stolthet för sitt jobb och de egenutvecklade lösningarna. Ditt uppdrag är att leda ditt team och fortsätta utveckla arbetssättet genom att i ännu större grad tillämpa CGIs processer och rutiner. I teamet som du leder finns gedigen expertkompetens inom IT-säkerhet.
   

  

 En team-medlem beskriver kulturen: ”Vi har högt i tak och vi delar med oss av vår kunskap, vilket är en förutsättning för att vi ska kunna leverera på topp. Driv, stark motivation och lojalitet kännetecknar oss. Samtidigt som vi älskar vårt jobb ser vi till att ha balans i livet, som är en självklarhet.”
   

  

 Kvalifikationer för att bli framgångsrik denna roll
   

  

 I den här rekryteringen kommer vi att lägga stor vikt vid dina ledaregenskaper. Du är trygg i dig själv och har förmåga att tillämpa situations anpassat ledarskap. Du är lyhörd inför dina medarbetares idéer och kunskap samtidigt som du är tydlig och har förmåga att fatta avvägda beslut som stöttar affärsplanen. Du behöver också kunna entusiasmera dina medarbetare i förändring.
   

  

* Ca 5 års ledarerfarenhet med personalansvar inom IT-banschen
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av att driva förändringsarbete med goda resultat
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta på ett större företag och förståelse för att arbeta processorienterat
* Erfarenhet av att jobba Agilt och det är meriterande om du har arbetat inom SAFe-ramverket
* För att trivas behöver du ha ett stort teknikintresse och grundläggande förståelse för Cyber Security


 Tjänsten är placerad i säkerhetsklass, varför du som söker behöver vara svensk medborgare. Du behöver också ha goda kunskaper i tal och skrift på Svenska och Engelska. Vill du veta mer om jobbet är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterande ledare Daniel Jensen, daniel.jensen@cgi.com
   

  

**Låt oss som ägare omvandla verklig insikt till handling – tillsammans.**
 Livet på CGI bygger på ägande, lagarbete, respekt och tillhörighet. Tillsammans med oss kommer du att kunna nå din fulla potential.
   

  

 Du är inbjuden att ta ägandeskap redan från första dagen i vårt arbete med att förverkliga vår dröm om att skapa en arbetsmiljö där vi trivs med att arbeta tillsammans och bidrar till framgången för vårt företag.
