title: Regional Systems Operations Manager
description:
**Join Schneider Electric as our Regional Systems Operations Manager!**
 Are you ready to take the lead in driving our Digital Buildings Systems to unparalleled success in Europe & France? As the Regional Systems Operations Manager, you'll play a pivotal role in elevating our systems organization for Data Centre projects, providing expert support from sales to flawless project execution. Join us in shaping the future of energy management and sustainability!
   

  

**What we offer you:**
* Competitive Rewards: Enjoy a competitive salary, bonus scheme, and a range of enticing benefits including 28 days annual leave, pension scheme, and employee share ownership programme.
* Health & Wellbeing: Access various health and wellbeing support options, gym flex, and a holiday buy & sell programme to suit your lifestyle.
* Career Development: Benefit from our Open Talent Market, offering internal mobility opportunities, access to mentors, and projects globally, along with our comprehensive learning portal.
* Inclusive Environment: Experience our commitment to diversity and inclusion, with opportunities for all and support for those considering themselves living with a disability.
* Perks and Discounts: Enjoy shopping and dining discounts as part of our employee perks package.


**What your mission will look like?**
* Champion the transformation of our Digital Buildings Systems to best in class, from selling to successful execution of systems organization for Data Centre projects in Europe & France.
* Provide invaluable support to our teams and clients, ensuring excellence in environment monitoring systems and driving high performance systems culture.


**Key responsibilities will include:**
* Driving bid assessment, customer project performance, and aligned execution approach across the region.
* Acting as a trusted advisor, ensuring consistent customer experience and knowledge transfer across all projects.
* Ensuring the development, implementation, and maintenance of global rules, methodologies, processes, and tools.


**What will help you succeed?**
* Excellent communication and leadership skills to drive high performance and collaboration
* Analytical skills to handle complex matters effectively and experience in builduing management systems
* Professional knowledge of the electrical industry and experience in the Lifescience segment are valued
* Experience in a multicultural team environment and readiness to travel


 Ready to make an impact with us?
   

  

 Join Schneider Electric and be part of a team shaping the future of energy management. Apply now and let us learn about you!
   

  

**Why us?**
 Schneider Electric is leading the digital transformation of energy management and automation. Our technologies enable the world to use energy in a safe, efficient and sustainable manner. We strive to promote a global economy that is both ecologically viable and highly productive.
   

  

 €34bn global revenue
   

  

 128 000+ employees in 100+ countries
   

  

 45% of revenue from IoT
   

  

 5% of revenue devoted for R&D
   

  

 You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled
   

  

 It is the policy of Schneider Electric to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities in the areas of recruiting, hiring, training, transferring, and promoting all qualified individuals regardless of race, religion, color, gender, disability, national origin, ancestry, age, military status, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristic or conduct. Concerning agencies: Schneider Electric does not accept unsolicited resumes and will not be responsible for fees related to such.

title: Technical Expert Active Directory
description:
Om tjänsten
   

  

**Are you looking for the next step in your career and contributing to a fossil free future at the same time?**
 For our team Collaboration, part of Vattenfall IT, we are looking for an ambitious
 **Technical Expert Active Directory** 
 in
 **Berlin, Stockholm, Gliwice or Katowice** 
 .
   

  

**What will you do?**
 The Active Directory & Collaboration department is responsible for providing all services connected to authentication and authorization as well as several collaboration tools, mainly focusing on mail and Office 365 services. Within the Active Directory team we are operating several services like Active Directory, Public Key Infrastructure and Domain Name Service, Distributed File Service, Always On VPN, Remote Gateway and Federation Services. There is now an opportunity for a person to join a positive and successful team with excellent team spirit and highly skilled team members. The position is placed in Stockholm (SE).
   

  

 Your tasks and responsibilities:
   

  

* Operate the Active Directory Forests and Public Key infrastructures needed in Vattenfall Group
* Operate the Always On VPN for remote working
* Operate Federation Services for Single Sign On for cloud applications
* Operate AzureAD and AzureAD Connect
* Secure access for privileged accounts or restricted applications based on tiering model by providing Multi Factor Authentication solutions as well as remote desktop gateway service
* Design and support improvement of the current landscape and future demands
* Responsible for operation of authentication and authorization within different Active Directory Forests
* Resolve service incidents and requests according to SLA’s
* Participate in on-call service
* Participate in Infrastructure and security related projects for Active Directory, Azure


 Group tasks:
   

  

 The Active Directory team takes care for the following services within Vattenfall and also some subsidiaries or external customers:
   

  

* Operate, maintain and secure on infrastructure level several dedicated Active Directory Forests, including PKI with different CA’s
* Operate, maintain and implemented federated authentication (e.g. ADFS) as well as always on VPN
* Operate and maintain AzureAD, Conditional Access and AzureAD Connect
* Tools to monitor and automate tasks and services based on operational demands
* Operating and maintaining secure environment for authentication services within dedicated tiering-mode


**Location**
 Berlin, Stockholm, Gliwice, Katowice
   

  

 Din bakgrund
   

  

**Who are you?**
 As our
 **Technical Expert Active Directory** 
 you bring strong problem solving skills, an open mindset and solid communication skills.
   

  

 Next to this you bring:
   

  

* Academic degree as an IT, mathematics, scientific or technical engineer or similar in IT
* Knowledge in Active Directory Services (Infrastructure as well as Service level), PKI, Always On VPN, ADFS, AzureAD and as well as basic knowledge of the Infrastructure services and technologies
* Programming skills (mainly PowerShell) are prerequisite
* Microsoft MSCA/E Active Directory, Microsoft Certified Identity and Access or Microsoft 365 Security Administration
* Good knowledge in ITIL and IT security
* A proven ability to communicate with technical experts, customers and group governance
* The ability to build trust and confidence and to be a team player in an international team
* Very good language skills in (technical) English


 Mer information
   

  

**Our offer**
 Good remuneration, a challenging and international work environment, and the possibility to work with some of the best in the field. You will be working in interdisciplinary teams and you can always count on support from committed colleagues. We offer attractive employment conditions and opportunities for personal and professional development.
   

  

**More Information**
 We welcome your application in English, not later than
 **22nd of September 2024.** 
 We kindly request that you do not send applications by any means other than via our website as we cannot guarantee that we will be able to process applications that are not made via our website.
   

  

 For more information about the recruitment process you are welcome to contact our recruiter Dominik Friebe via phone: +49 (0)40 79022 1374.
   

  

 Trade union representatives in Sweden Silvija Vatkovic (Akademikerna), Inger Strandberg (Unionen), Christer Gustafsson (Ledarna), Lennart Bengtsson (SEKO). To get in contact with the representatives, please call Vattenfall´s switchboard +46 8 739 50 00.
   

  

 At Vattenfall we are convinced that diversity contributes to build a more profitable and attractive company and we strive to be good role model regarding diversity. Vattenfall works actively for all employees to have the same opportunities and rights regardless of gender, ethnicity, age, transgender identity or expression, religion or other belief, disability or sexual orientation.
   

  

 Since Vattenfall is a part of the Swedish critical infrastructure, many of our services are security classed. If this position is security classed the final candidates might be subjected to a security vetting process, according to the Swedish legislation.
   

  

**We look forward to receiving your application!**
 Om oss
   

  

 Vattenfall is a European energy company with approximately 20 000 employees. For more than 100 years we have electrified industries, supplied energy to people’s homes and modernized our way of living through innovation and cooperation. We now want to make fossil-free living possible within one generation. To be able to reach this ambitious goal we are looking for talented individuals who, in addition to their passion for their own role, also have strong team spirit and want to contribute to supporting a meaningful corporate mission.

title: Systemtekniker till Riksidrottsförbundet!
description:
Idrottsrörelsen är inne i en dynamisk förändringsprocess. Här drivs idrott i förening för att ha roligt, må bra och utvecklas hela livet och varje dag tar vi ännu ett steg på resan mot en mer nyfiken och välkomnande idrottsrörelse. IT-avdelningen ansvarar för att ge support till anställda och alla våra medlemsförbund samt förvaltar och utvecklar IT-miljön med fokus på säkerhet och tillgänglighet. Som System- och drifttekniker är du en viktig del i att säkerställa att idrottens medlemmar friktionsfritt kan arbeta med de digitala verktygen. Har du några års erfarenhet inom drift och är redo för nästa steg? Häng med på vår resa!
 



  

**Företag :**
 Sveriges Riksidrottsförbund
 



  

**Plats :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 IT
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid, 100%
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Enligt överenskommelse
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Rekrytering
 



  

**Övrigt :**
 Möjlighet till distansarbete
   




**Om tjänsten**

 Riksidrottsförbundet (RF) är idrottsrörelsens samlande organisation med uppgift att stödja, företräda, leda och samordna idrottsrörelsen i gemensamma frågor, såväl nationellt som internationellt. Riksidrottsförbundet har 72 medlemsförbund (specialidrottsförbund, SF) som tillsammans har cirka 19 000 idrottsföreningar och totalt samlar idrottsrörelsen cirka 3,3 miljoner medlemmar vilket innebär ett stort antal användare av förbundets digitala verktyg. Du kommer ett ingå i ett team om fyra personer samt din närmsta chef och ni jobbar tillsammans främst med driften av idrottens administrativa verksamhetssystem IdrottOnline, en integrationsplattform, Microsoft 365 samt den infrastruktur som krävs för den digitala arbetsplatsen. Dina kollegor finns på två olika arbetsplatser - Idrottens Hus vid Skanstull och Bosön på Lidingö. Arbete kan förekomma på bägge arbetsplatserna men du kommer främst att spendera din arbetstid på kontoret i Skanstull.
 


  


  

**Några ord från din framtida närmsta chef:**



  


 Hej, Jag heter Victoria och är IT-chef på Sveriges Riksidrottsförbund och SISU Idrottsutbildarna. När jag började här för drygt 2 år sedan möttes jag av en otroligt välkomnande och trevlig arbetsplats där alla arbetar för visionen Svensk idrott världens bästa. Digitaliseringen går snabbt och för att trivas här måste man vara lösningsfokuserad och inspireras av nya utmaningar. Inom verksamhetsområdet IT och Digital utveckling arbetar vi i nära samarbete med varandra vilket skapar en bra sammanhållning där vi både utvecklar och stöttar varandra i det dagliga arbetet och dess utmaningar. Som ledare är mitt mål att coacha och stötta mina medarbetare i att utmana sig själva och att utvecklas. Jag kommer att finnas där som bollplank för alla typer av frågor, från stöd i övergripande tekniska beslut till att hitta nya sätt att lösa utmaningar.
   

 Ta chansen och bli en del av vårt härliga team där vi tillsammans gör allt för att stötta hela Sveriges idrottsrörelse!
 


  


  

**Du erbjuds**



  

  
* Arbete i en roll där du får jobba brett med olika uppgifter inom IT-drift
  
* Arbete i organisation där det händer mycket och som är under snabb utveckling vilket vi tror kommer ge dig goda möjligheter att utvecklas i din roll
  
* En välkomnande arbetsgivare som värnar om trivsel och välmående på arbetat genom att erbjuda möjligheten till tre dagars arbete på kontor och två dagars på distans per vecka (om arbetet tillåter), 2 timmars friskvård i veckan, 3000 kr i friskvårdsbidrag per år samt lunchförmåner. Här finns också en trivselgrupp vars uppgift är att skapar det där lilla extra sociala i vardagen på jobbet!
  


  


  

**Arbetsuppgifter**



  


 Du kommer huvudsakligen jobba med att hantera driften av IT-miljön vilket innebär övervakning, installation, uppgradering, konfigurering, utveckling samt optimering av infrastrukturen för IdrottOnline, integrationsplattformen samt Microsoft 365. Detta är en roll för dig och som vill jobba brett och lära dig nya tekniker och arbetssätt. Du kommer framförallt att jobba med drift av Windowsservrar men Riksidrottsförbundet jobbar utöver det bland annat med Linux, Cisco, Meraki, Docker, Kubernetes, Prometheus, Terraform, Gravitee, ArgoCD, Curity, Microsoft Dynamics 365 m.fl. och är det områden du inte kan sedan innan så är det något du kommer få utvecklas och lära dig mer inom här!
   




**Vi söker dig som**

 I denna rekrytering kommer vi lägga stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper och intresse för tjänsten och Riksidrottsförbundet som organisation. Vi ser att du är duktig på att samarbeta, du gillar att tänka nytt och att utveckla dig själv och att ta ansvar för såväl din egen utveckling som det gemensamma resultatet i teamet.
 


  


  

**Vidare har du…**



  

  
* Minst några års erfarenhet av drift, underhåll, konfigurering och felsökning av system och nätverk
  
* Kunskaper inom Windows Server
  
* Kunskaper inom Microsoft Azure
  
* Kunskaper inom DevOps
  
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska då det är det primära arbetsspråket
  


  


  

**Vi ser det som meriterande om du också har…**



  

  
* Kunskaper inom Kubernetes
  
* Kunskaper inom SQL
  
* Kunskaper inom Microsoft 365
  


  


  

**Rekryteringsprocessen**



  

  
* Telefonintervju med Academic Work
  
* Problem- och personlighetstester
  
* Djupintervju med Academic Work
  
* Intervjuer med Riksidrottsförbundet
  
* Referenstagning + beslut
  


  


  

**Övrig information**



  

  
* Placering: Skanstull, möjlighet till visst distansarbete
  
* Start: Enligt överenskommelse
  
* Omfattning: Heltid
  
* Kontaktuppgifter: Ansvarig rekryteringskonsult Johanna Sörell, johanna.sorell@academicwork.se
  


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och kommer plocka ner annonsen när tillräckligt många kandidater har nått slutskedet i rekryteringsprocessen. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
   




**Sveriges Riksidrottsförbund**

 Läs mer om Riksidrottsförbundet på deras hemsida !
   




**Bli direktrekryterad till Sveriges Riksidrottsförbund**

 Detta är en direktrekrytering, vilket betyder att den kandidat som får tjänsten blir direktanställd av kundföretaget. Rekryteringsprocessen hanteras av Academic Work.
   




**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Johanna Sörell eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på stv3@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15106090

title: Software Engineer - OpenStack
description:
This is an exciting opportunity for a software engineer passionate about open source software, Linux, and OpenStack. Come build a rewarding, meaningful career working with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical, a growing international software company.
   

  

 As a software engineer on the OpenStack Engineering team, you'll be building Charmed OpenStack and Ceph, a suite of open source Python based charms for deploying and managing OpenStack and Ceph. Your work will bring cloud platform technologies to a wide range of users and computing environments, from desktops to bare metal servers. This role requires a python software developer with a passion for automating infrastructure as code.
   

  

 Applicants should be passionate about the future of the software defined datacenter, distributed systems, and open source. Canonical is a globally distributed team of engineers who share that passion, and you will need to work well in that context. Engineers who thrive at Canonical are mindful of the dynamics of the open source ecosystem, and equally aware of the needs of large, innovative organizations.
   

  

 This job involves international travel several times a year, usually for one week at a time.
   

  

 What you'll do
   

  

* Collaborate proactively with a distributed team
* Write high quality code to create new features
* Debug issues and produce high quality code to fix them
* Review code produced by other engineers
* Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions
* Ensure the success of OpenStack and Ceph on multiple architectures
* Work from home with global travel 2 to 4 weeks for internal and external events


 Who you are
   

  

* You love technology and working with brilliant people
* You are curious, flexible, articulate, and accountable
* You value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated
* You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree
* You have experience with Python
* You have interest and experience with two or more of the following:Ubuntu Linux - kernel or userspace, Kubernetes, OpenStack, Ceph, AI/ML, QEMU/KVM, LXC/LXD, Python, Go, C, Postgresql, Mongo, Debian packaging, scalable web services
* You have experience with non-x86 architectures, including s390, arm64, power and others
* You have experience with OpenStack, OVN, Openvswitch and other related cloud technologies


 What Canonical Offers
   

  

* Learning and Development
* Annual Compensation Review
* Recognition Rewards
* Annual Leave
* Priority Pass for travel
* Flexible working option


 Canonical believes a diverse workforce enhances our ability to deliver world class software and services which meet the world's computing needs. We are committed to ensuring equal employment opportunities to all qualified individuals. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.
   

  

 Keywords: python, agile, lean, distributed systems, openstack, ceph, containers, kubernetes, docker, scale-out, orchestration, linux, ubuntu, cloud, devops, open source, serverless, networking, home, remote job, software development, software engineering, openstack
   

  

 Job location: Remote, home-based, Americas

title: Technical Manager - ATS Digital Services
description:
We build a platform for controlling & monitoring self-driving vehicles
   

  

 Scania is currently undergoing an exciting transformation from a traditional truck manufacturer to a provider of complete sustainable transport solutions. Autonomous Transport is a crucial part of this transformation as Scania’s and Traton’s success depends on flexible and efficient solutions that support current and future business requirements.
   

  

 Autonomous Intelligent Control System is a section at Scania Research & Development. Guided by our vision of integrated autonomy we contribute to Autonomous Transport Solutions (ATS) by providing cloud-based systems for automated, optimized, and safe vehicle control and monitoring, all built into one platform. We call this technology area ATS Digital Services.
   

  

 We are looking for a technical manager who drives the technology area of digital services for ATS. The role will have a significant strategic impact, encompassing a wide range of responsibilities within our technology area. You will be part of the section management team and be the main technology voice in the team. Your reporting line will be to the section manager for the Autonomous Intelligent Control System.
   

  

 If you want to contribute to building optimized, intelligent & differentiating products in the ATS area this is your call!
   

  

 Your mission
   

  

 As part of your role, you are tasked with ensuring progress and maintaining a competitive edge for Traton in the strategically important technology area of ATS digital services. This involves driving the technology area from inception to deployment and validation. You will own the technology area roadmap and actively gather business intelligence with a global industry perspective.
   

  

 Who you are
   

  

 You are a technology leader with a proven track record of leading diverse teams across sites, preferably as a line manager. You have a visionary and influential communication style that helps articulate complex technical concepts in business-relevant terms to various stakeholders, from development engineers to senior and executive management. Your approach is characterized by enthusiasm and empathy towards team members, allowing you to understand their challenges and effectively integrate various resources and departments. You are self-managing, curious, and dare to try.
   

  

 You'll need
   

  

  

* Technology Expertise: Deep expert knowledge of the technology behind ATS digital services, including AI & machine learning, knowledge graphs, software systems, data streaming, cloud computing, data analytics, and telemetry.
* Strategic Planning capacity: Ability to contribute to long-term strategic planning, aligning technological developments with business objectives.
* System Architecture understanding: Knowledge of system architecture relevant to ATS, enabling effective guidance and support for system architects and teams.
* Data Analysis and Interpretation: Capability to analyze complex data to inform critical decisions, focusing on improving operational efficiency.
* Cybersecurity and Data Privacy: In-depth understanding of cybersecurity and regulatory compliance, particularly with data privacy laws and protection data transmitted between trucks and off-board systems.


**Other Qualities**
 The ideal candidate for this role possesses a deep understanding of the global ATS industry, essential for Scania's international activities. They demonstrate adaptability to evolving technologies and industry dynamics, coupled with a visionary outlook that shapes the future of ATS in alignment with Scania's strategic vision. Proficient in change management, they effectively lead through transitions, particularly in the adoption of new technologies and processes. Furthermore, they prioritize ethical considerations and sustainability throughout the development and deployment of autonomous solutions.
   

  

 If you possess some (not necessarily all) of the requirements mentioned, we encourage you to apply with confidence. Every application is valued, and we welcome you to join us on this exciting journey of sustainability-driven innovation. Your unique skills and experiences could be a perfect fit for our team!
   

  

 Our offer
   

  

 We offer a healthy and inspiring workplace, with respect for the individual, where you have great opportunities to shape your work and your future. Your personal and professional development is important and something we encourage and support.
   

  

 We believe in modern leadership thinking and an agile way of working, and we think you will fit perfectly into that mindset. We work from home and at our campus-like office in Södertälje. So, with some planning, you will find a good work/life balance.
   

  

 Looking forward to hearing from you, feel free to reach out to me if you have any questions. Andreas Höglund, Senior Engineering Manager, + 46 553 896 12.
   

  

 Application
   

  

 Your application should include CV and degree certificate. Instead of a cover letter, please answer the questions stated when you submit your application.
   

  

 Please apply no later than 2024-09-10. A background check might be conducted for this position.

title: Freelance Content Creator (LinkedIn Marketing) – Sweden
description:
**Company Overview:** 
 We are a dynamic IT consulting firm specializing in Microsoft Business Central, Power BI, and Azure Cloud solutions. As we expand our presence in Sweden, we are looking to enhance our marketing efforts by creating engaging and informative content for our LinkedIn audience. We aim to connect with Business Central consultants, developers, and potential clients by showcasing our expertise and driving business growth.
 



  





**Role Overview:** 
 We are seeking a creative and experienced Freelance Content Creator to develop and produce high-quality text and video content for our LinkedIn marketing campaigns. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of LinkedIn as a platform and experience in creating content that resonates with professionals in the IT and business consulting sectors.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Develop compelling and informative text and video content tailored for our LinkedIn audience.
* Collaborate with our team to create content strategies that align with our business goals and target audience.
* Research and stay up-to-date with the latest trends in IT consulting, Business Central, and digital marketing to produce relevant content.
* Write articles, posts, and scripts that highlight our expertise, case studies, industry insights, and more.
* Create short, engaging videos that can be shared on LinkedIn, focusing on our services, client success stories, and thought leadership.
* Optimize content for maximum engagement and reach on LinkedIn.
* Monitor and analyze content performance, providing recommendations for continuous improvement.



  





**Qualifications:** 



* Proven experience as a content creator, particularly for LinkedIn or other professional platforms.
* Strong writing, editing, and video production skills.
* Knowledge of Microsoft Business Central, Power BI, Azure Cloud, or related IT consulting services is a plus.
* Ability to work independently and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Native or fluent Swedish speaker with strong English proficiency.



  





**What We Offer:** 



* Competitive freelance compensation based on experience and project scope.
* Flexibility to work remotely with a focus on results and creativity.
* The opportunity to be part of an innovative company expanding into new markets.
* A collaborative team environment with a focus on growth and development.



  





**How to Apply:** 
 Interested candidates are invited to apply via LinkedIn, including their resume, portfolio (with LinkedIn content examples), and a brief cover letter outlining their experience and why they are a good fit for this role. Please also include your pricing structure or hourly rate.
 



 We look forward to seeing how you can help us take our LinkedIn marketing to the next level!

title: Java Automation Lead
description:
**Job Description:** 



* Test lead architect with 10 years of technical expertise in Test Automation Agile Management and DevOps
* Strategize enterprise test automation initiatives align long term solutions including roadmap ROI tools framework approach
* Experience in designing and implementing different automation frameworks like Page Object Model Data Keyword Driven framework and BDD
* Strong knowledge of Java Programming language
* Implemented test automation strategy across application layers UIAPIMQ etc
* Hands on experience in using SCM tools such as Github Bitbucket etc and Continuous Integration tool Jenkins or similar tools
* Good Understanding of DevOps concepts with knowledge to build CICD pipelines
* Exposure to Performance testing tools such as JMeter and exposure to APM solutions like AppDynamics or similar tools
* Experience in Financial systems Trading domain is an added advantage

title: Säljande Konsultchef
company: KiMM - en del av Wise Professionals
description:
Vår tillväxtresa på SalesOnly & KIMM, en del av Wise koncernen är i full gång och vi behöver fler kollegor som vill vara med och forma framtidens sälj och marknadsavdelningar. Sök tjänsten som säljande konsultchef idag och bli en del av vårt team i Stockholm!
   

  

**Om SalesOnly & KIMM**
 Sedan 2013 har KiMM varit i frontlinjen för att forma framtidens marknadsteam. Vi anpassar oss inte bara till förändringar – vi är med och leder dem. Vi förstår de unika utmaningarna som varje roll, team och ledare möter i en snabbföränderlig värld. KiMM är därför mer än en rekryteringspartner; vi är strategiska rådgivare och ditt bästa bollplank som lyfter din marknad -och kommunikationsavdelning till nya höjder.
   

  

 SalesOnly är de överlägset starkaste på marknaden när det kommer till att driva utvecklingen av säljorganisationer, inte bara genom att de erbjuder de främsta talangerna inom Sälj/säljledning samt operativa VD roller. SalesOnly är ett premiumvarumärke när det gäller rekrytering, interim och search av säljare, säljchefer samt VD roller.
   

  

 Tillsammans skapar SalesOnly och KiMM synergier som optimerar både försäljning och marknadskommunikation, vilket gör oss till oumbärliga partners för alla företag som vill ligga i framkant.
   

  

**Om Rollen**
 I rollen som säljande konsultchef hos SalesOnly och KIMM kommer du att ha en bred, varierad och utmanande arbetsvardag med stor möjlighet till påverkan. Vi lägger stor vikt vid att göra en betydande skillnad för våra kandidater, konsulter och kunder. För att säkerställa det arbetar vi aktivt med proaktivitet, kvalitet, samarbete och alltid med ett stort hjärta i allt vi gör. Du kommer tillsammans med dina konsultchefskollegor och kandidatansvariga ansvara för hela processen inom vår konsultuthyrningsaffär.
   

  

**Ytterligare Arbetsuppgifter Kommer Att Vara**
* Projektleda och vägleda dina kunder vid nya tillsättningar av konsulter ute hos våra kunder
* Ha en aktiv kundbearbetning i form av kreativa och relationsskapande insatser för att hålla i de goda relationerna med befintliga kunder samt bearbeta nya potentiella kunder
* Ha personalansvar för drygt 20–25 konsulter och eftersom vi älskar att ha en nära relation med våra kandidater och konsulter förväntas du ansvara för dina konsulters resa hos oss – det inkluderar alltifrån anställning, uppföljning, coaching och utvecklingssamtal


**Varför Salesonly och KIMM?**
 Förutom ett väldigt utvecklande och roligt jobb så kommer du också att ingå i ett familjärt och affärsdrivet gäng på 20 personer som består av Talent Acquisition Specialists, konsultchefer och rekryteringskonsulter i Stockholm, Göteborg och Malmö. Du rapporterar till Vd Jenny Berge, samt kommer utgå från vårt nyrenoverade huvudkontor på Östermalm i centrala Stockholm. Rollen är flexibel men du förväntas arbeta på kontoret minst 3 dagar i veckan. Utöver SalesOnly och KIMM gänget så kommer du sitta i samma hus som drygt 200 andra medarbetare från vår koncern, Wise Group. Du blir därmed en del av det ”lilla bolaget i det stora bolaget”.
   

  

**Förutsättningar för att lyckas.** 
 För att trivas i vår kultur tror vi att du delar vår passion att göra affärer, nätverk och rekrytering.
   

  

 I Den Här Rollen Söker Vi Dig Som Har En Stor Egen Drivkraft, Affärsmässighet Och Ser Fram Emot Att Bygga Upp Och Utveckla Vårt Affärsområde i Stockholm. Utöver Detta Hoppas Vi Att Du
   

  

* Har några års erfarenhet av konsultbranschen som Konsultchef eller rekryteringskonsult.
* Har arbetat affärsinriktad, säljande och resultatorienterat i dina roller och trivs med det.
* Är du flytande i svenska i både tal och skrift, samt har goda kunskaper i engelska.


**Meriterande Punkter**
* Har arbetat med att tillsätta roller och konsulter inom sälj & marknad
* Har du eftergymnasial utbildning inom företagsekonomi, HR eller annat relevant område.
* Arbetat i en tillväxtmiljö som start/scale-up
* Har ett stort nätverk med hjälp av tidigare roller


 Önskas ytterligare information når du ansvarig Rekryteringskonsult Linnea Lindroth på 076 525 38 59 eller linnea.lindroth@salesonly.se
   

  

 Alla ansökningar och kontakter behandlas konfidentiellt.
   

  

 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Senior DataOps Engineer
description:
Are you ready to elevate your career and become a part of a team that is transforming the way TRATON delivers exceptional software solutions to our customers? We are on the lookout for a Senior DataOps Engineer who is expert in data pipelines and enhancing data strategies to join our dynamic team. You will be working in a hybrid work-setting with exciting and complex software development!
   

  

**Who We Are**
 We are dedicated to an inclusive and diverse workplace. You will join a diverse and competent team with a friendly, helpful and inclusive atmosphere. The team has a common vision of the goals and values, allowing us to take our jobs seriously while having fun at the same time. We care for each other’s personal development to learn, grow and evolve, in order to make our deliveries the best we can produce. Be yourself and reveal your talents!
   

  


**Your Role**
 In your role as a Senior DataOps Engineer, you are an essential contributor to our mission of establishing a world-class developer experience. You will scope, design, and implement developer experience focused on pipeline efficiency and infrastructure for a connected development loop inspired by Platform Engineering. The aim is to enable our engineers to validate and deploy their ideas within 24 hours of conception. Seize this opportunity to work with cutting-edge technology and make a significant impact on the industry!
   

  

 You will have the chance to contribute to our “developer platform” and “developer portal” initiatives. These elements are integral to any modern tech organization. You will collaborate with a skilled team to develop and sustain these vital components. You will also contribute to creating pipelines and supporting infrastructure to enable self-service workflows across these capabilities.
   

  

  

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* You will work with DataOps in the whole chain from hardware to ML and LLM using modern approach and best practices to cater business needs for TRATON.
* You will create tools to aid in management and infrastructure of data.
* You will enhance the current pipelines and visualisation by integrating to the developer portal.
* You will encourage and improve knowledge sharing by working with peers from across the organization, sharing your experience, learning from others and contributing to our shared knowledge base.
* You will evaluate the performance of our solutions and seek ways to improve them.


  

  


**Qualifications**
* Programming experience in Python and scripting experience.
* Experience with containerization, Cloud Computing (AWS or Azure preferred), Kubernetes, Kafka and Graphana.
* Automation and orchestration experience including Terraform, Helm, GitLab CI, ArgoCD.
* Experience in setting up monitoring for infrastructure and applications with tools such as Prometheus, Datadog, OpenTelemetry.
* Experience in configuring and troubleshooting container environments.
* Experience in data driven development, preferably within the ML context.
* Strong communication and collaboration skills.


  

  

**Experience with the following is meritorious:**
* Developing pipelines for ML and LLM products.
* Working with Big data in an industrial context.
* Previous experience working with a data pipeline from distributed hardware to a central data store.
* Working collaboratively in an Agile/Scrum environment.


**Application**
 Your application should include a CV, personal letter, and grade copies. Ongoing selection and interviews will take place during the application period, the position may be filled before the end of the application period.
   

  

 We use logic and personality tests in our selection process and a background check may be conducted for this position.
   

  

 Welcome to apply!
   

  

**Further information**
 If you would like to learn more about the position please contact Mariette Annergren (Group Manager, EEDCD) at +46855353145.
   

  

 and Elvedin Ramic (Group Manager, EEDCE) +46855350687

title: Partner Account Manager, GFI Software (Remote) - $60,000/year USD
description:
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, GFI Software. Have you got what it takes?
   

  

 Are you ready to step into the future of sales and channel management? The channel management industry often grapples with inefficiencies in scaling operations, maintaining consistent growth, and effectively integrating technology to enhance partner interactions. Many companies still rely on traditional methods that lack data-driven decision-making and advanced analytical capabilities.
   

  

 At GFI, we revolutionize this space by integrating Generative AI across all facets of our channel management processes. Our cutting-edge approach not only optimizes operations but also drives sustained revenue growth by enhancing the efficiency and effectiveness of our network of distributors, resellers, and MSPs. This is an electrifying opportunity to be at the forefront of tech-driven sales innovation, leveraging AI to transform standard practices into dynamic, strategic engagements that deliver measurable results.
   

  

 This role is not your typical channel sales role. You will be expected to master and deploy Generative AI tools, ensuring our partnerships are not just maintained but also optimized and expanded through strategic data-driven methodologies. Your work will involve rigorous partner recruitment, dynamic training sessions, and stringent performance assessments—all enhanced by advanced AI.
   

  

 You'll fit into a team of forward-thinkers where each member is crucial in sculpting the future landscape of channel sales. Your role is pivotal in shaping how partnerships flourish in a tech-driven environment, ensuring both the growth of GFI and our partners. If you are eager to redefine industry standards and possess a robust blend of GenerativeAI proficiency, professional communication, and channel sales management, we encourage you to apply. Join us in transforming the blueprint of channel management and take your place as a leader in a cutting-edge sales revolution.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Partner Recruitment and Onboarding: Identifying, recruiting, and onboarding new partners to expand the channel network. This involves evaluating potential partners' alignment with the company's values and goals, as well as their market reach and capabilities.
* Training and Development: Providing partners with the necessary training and resources to effectively sell and support the product. This includes product training, sales techniques, and ongoing professional development to enhance their capabilities.
* Performance Monitoring and Management: Continuously monitoring the performance of partners against predefined benchmarks and metrics. This includes regular assessment of sales figures, customer feedback, and other performance indicators to identify areas for improvement.


**What You Won’t Be Doing**
* Directly selling to end-user customers
* Prioritizing the quantity of interactions over the quality of your engagements with partners
* Worrying about unpredictable earnings and relentless travel demands


**Partner Account Manager Key Responsibilities**
* Sustained revenue growth from efficiently managing and optimizing a network of distributors, resellers, and MSPs using GenerativeAI tools


**Basic Requirements**
* Professional experience leveraging multiple LLMs (ChatGPT, Gemini, Claude, etc.) and AI tools to automate manual tasks and boost your company's productivity (if you've only ever used ChatGPT, that's probably not enough)
* 1+ year of indirect channel sales experience in the software industry (direct sales experience does not count)


**About GFI Software**
 GFI Software develops essential applications for small and medium businesses. Over 80,000 customers choose GFI solutions for network management and performance, security, and collaboration applications. GFI Software available through thousands of channel partners dedicated to serving specific countries and regions worldwide.
   

  

 GFI has a fully remote, global workforce. GFI has partnered with Crossover to administer its hiring and global workforce management.
   

  

 There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!
   

  

**Working with Crossover**
 This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $30 USD/hour, which equates to $60,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.
   

  

**What to expect next:**
* You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.
* Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.


**Important!** 
 If you do not receive an email from us:
   

  

* First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.
* Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.
* Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.
* If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.


 Crossover Job Code: LJ-5278-SE-Stockhol-PartnerAccount.001

title: Senior Data Scientist - Credit Risk: Klarna Card
description:
**About Us**
 With over 150 million global active users and 2 million transactions per day, Klarna is on the way to becoming the world’s favorite way to shop. To help us get there, we’re assembling an unparalleled global talent team—accelerating individual careers, and disrupting entire industries. We’re looking for people ready to achieve the extraordinary and embrace our bold ambitions as we shape the future of payments and fintech. Will you join us?
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Lead the development of advanced credit risk models for Klarna Card, focusing on card origination and limit management to ensure continued success across global markets.
* Enhance underwriting processes and the customer experience by leveraging cutting-edge machine learning techniques.
* Develop, deploy, and maintain state-of-the-art predictive models, creating robust end-to-end data pipelines within Klarna’s cloud environments.
* Collaborate with a diverse team of experts from around the globe, bringing your unique perspective to the table and learning from others.


**Who You Are**
* Extensive experience in risk, portfolio management, banking, finance, model validation, or product analytics.
* Proficiency in developing classification models using machine learning techniques.
* Strong experience with Python, SQL, and Git, along with a solid understanding of cloud computing concepts.
* Deep theoretical knowledge of both classical and modern machine learning models and algorithms, including generalized linear models, random forests, ensemble methods, and deep neural networks.
* Excellent communication, organizational, and teamwork skills.
* A strong academic background in a highly technical and numerate subject (e.g., Mathematics, Physics, Engineering, or Economics).


****Closing****
 Please include a CV in English.
   

  

 Since 2005 Klarna has been on a mission to revolutionize the retail banking industry. With over 150 million global active users and 2 million transactions per day, Klarna is meeting the changing demands of consumers by saving them time and money while helping them be informed and in control.
   

  

 Over 450,000 global retail partners, including H&M, Saks, Sephora, Macys, IKEA, Expedia Group, and Nike have integrated Klarna's innovative technology to deliver a seamless shopping experience online and in-store. Klarna has over 3,500 employees and is active in 45 markets.

title: Principal Platform Software Engineer
description:
The era of pervasive AI has arrived. In this era, organizations will use generative AI to unlock hidden value in their data, accelerate processes, reduce costs, drive efficiency and innovation to fundamentally transform their businesses and operations at scale.
   

  

 SambaNova Suite™ is the first full-stack, generative AI platform, from chip to model, optimized for enterprise and government organizations. Powered by the intelligent SN40L chip, the SambaNova Suite is a fully integrated platform, delivered on-premises or in the cloud, combined with state-of-the-art open-source models that can be easily and securely fine-tuned using customer data for greater accuracy. Once adapted with customer data, customers retain model ownership in perpetuity, so they can turn generative AI into one of their most valuable assets.
   

  

**Working at SambaNova**
 This role presents a unique opportunity to shape the future of AI and the value it can unlock across every aspect of an organization’s business and operations. It is a high-visibility position which will shape the future of the AI platform in delivering the best-in-class cost-performance software solutions.
   

  

 SambaNova is hiring a
 **Sr Platform Software Engineer** 
 to lead the technical evolution of the developer experience as we scale to a world-class global SaaS provider.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Build cutting-edge customized tooling solutions to run complex workloads at scale across hybrid cloud environments to enhance software development, testing, and deployment efficiency
* Profile components of these workloads to identify bottlenecks and inefficiencies and develop solutions to improve overall time and resource utilization
* Drive the adoption of cutting-edge public cloud technologies across hybrid cloud environments to accelerate overall developer velocity
* Develop robust and scalable systems for building and managing software artifacts like Linux packages, container images and Python wheels
* Oversee the maintenance of leading continuous integration systems and ensure seamless integration with other systems and tools for optimal performance
* Design and implement streamlined industry-standard practices and policies for DevOps, GitOps and MLOps across various teams and functions.
* Work closely with stakeholders to assess and implement enterprise-level systems that align with the organization's goals and objectives


**Basic Qualifications**
* 7+ years in software engineering, technology architecture, and DevOps with a demonstrated ability to design, implement, and maintain secure, scalable, and resilient systems to support software development and deployment
* BS in CS, CE, EE or relevant field


**Additional Required Qualifications**
* Strong computer science fundamentals
* Extensive experience building enterprise-grade software with Python, Go, or other modern programming languages
* Deep knowledge of distributed systems and cloud platform concepts
* Solid understanding of fundamental CI/CD, GitOps, and DevOps concepts and experience with building pipelines using technologies such as Jenkins or CircleCI
* Strong understanding of Linux operating system concepts and proficiency with Python and Bash scripting
* Strong technical acumen with Kubernetes and hands-on experience with deploying and managing services on clusters using tools like Helm and ArgoCD
* Deep understanding of provisioning infrastructure in a hybrid-cloud environment, infrastructure-as-code (IaC) principles, and familiarity with relevant technologies such as Ansible and Terraform
* Experience building and deploying robust and secure web APIs and microservices
* Familiarity with container image building and container runtimes
* Experience building Linux packages and distribution platforms like Artifactory or similar technologies
* Experience building systems for data analytics using the ELK (Elasticsearch, Logstash, and Kibana) stack or similar technologies
* Proficient in cloud computing technologies and have experience working with Amazon Web Services (AWS), Microsoft Azure, or Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
* Proven high-growth startup experience in scaling and supporting engineering teams, with the ability to lead by example and foster a high-performance culture
* Action oriented with a focus on speed and results
* Ability to thrive in a no-boundaries culture and make an impact on innovation


**Annual Salary Range and Level**
 The base salary for this position ranges from $165,000/year up to $180,000/year. This range is based on role, level, and location and reflects the salary target for new hires in the US. Individual pay within the range will depend on a number of factors, including a candidate’s job-related qualifications, skills, competencies and experience, and location.
   

  

**Benefits Summary For US-Based Full-Time Direct Employment Positions**
**(The Recruiter will provide benefit details for non-US-based roles)**
 SambaNova offers a competitive total rewards package, including the base salary, plus equity and benefits. We cover 95% premium coverage for employee medical insurance, and 77% premium coverage for dependents and offer a Health Savings Account (HSA) with employer contribution. We also offer Dental, Vision, Short/Long term Disability, Basic Life, Voluntary Life, and AD&D insurance plans in addition to Flexible Spending Account (FSA) options like Health Care, Limited Purpose, and Dependent Care. Our library of well-being benefits available to you and your dependents includes a full subscription to Headspace, Gympass+ membership with access to physical gyms, One Medical membership, counseling services with an Employee Assistance Program, and much more.
   

  

**Submission Guidelines**
 Please note that in order to be considered an applicant for any position at SambaNova Systems, you must submit an application form for each position for which you believe you are qualified.
   

  

*If you are a new, recent (within the last two years), or upcoming college graduate and are interested in opportunities with SambaNova Systems, please apply through our university job listings.*
**EEO Policy**
 SambaNova Systems is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard basis of age (40 and over), color, disability, gender identity, genetic information, marital status, military or veteran status, national origin/ancestry, race, religion, creed, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding), sexual orientation, and any other applicable status protected by federal, state, or local laws.

title: Data Engineer - Business intelligence developer to Scania
description:
Do you love working with loads of interesting data? Do you have a passion for data modelling? Are you excited to apply your technical skills to analyse data, and help Scania get new valuable insights from it? Then we would like to welcome you as a Data Engineer to our team at Scania!
   

  

*Scania is currently undergoing an exciting transformation from a traditional truck manufacturer to a provider of complete sustainable transport solutions. IT is a crucial part of this transformation as Scania’s success is depending on flexible and efficient IT solutions that support current and future business requirements. Be a part of this journey as a BI developer.*
*Our department plays a large role in Scania’s data strategy to deliver state of the art analytical solutions. We enable and enhance data to empower our employees to perform at their best by providing excellent solutions that increase and secure the right decisions to reach and exceed the business goals.*
**YOU WILL**
 Be a part of a Squad consisting of BI developers and a Service Delivery Manager working with different organizations in Scania. You will be part of a very open and welcoming team’ that has a passion for working with BI solutions, and together you will create BI reports that bring value to our customers. You will have the possibility to work at least 3 days remotely per week.
   

  

 We work closely with business (Business & IT as One) and with various stakeholder groups to gather and document reporting requirements to meet business needs. We use scrum methodologies and sprints to follow up our work. Together with the squad, you will be developing high quality BI solutions including new projects as well as enhancing our existing portfolio with new requirements and performance adjustments. Our technical platforms are in both cloud and on prem. The cloud setup is AWS based with Snowflake as a data warehouse, Matillion as our ETL/ELT tool and PowerBI as a visualization tool. Our legacy on prem platform with the Scania common data warehouse is Oracle based and SQL server on prem with Power BI as visualization tool. We are in a very exciting transition phase to move away from on prem into our highly capable cloud platform with hundreds of data sources and hundreds of reporting applications.
   

  

**IN ORDER TO SUCCEED IN THE ROLE, WE SEE THAT YOU HAVE**
* 4+years in PowerBI development (on Cloud + Report server) with good knowledge of working with Cloud Technologies (Snowflake) and support.
* 4+years’ experience in Developing Solutions for Data Analytics such as building semantic models.
* Strong DAX programming knowledge.
* Working experience with both low code and high code environments for ETL such as Matillion, ODI, DBT
* Deep knowledge about dimensional modelling, data access and data storage
* Advanced SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases
* Experience of Tabular Editor and other BI/DW tools.
* Basic understanding on git branching, Push and Pull code to and from git repository
* Strong English language skills
* Involved in requirement gathering for reporting application and worked with customer
* BSc or MSc in Computer Science or related field (or equivalent experience)


**WE SEE IT AS A BIG PLUS IF YOU HAVE ONE OR MORE OF THE FOLLOWING:**
* You have experience from working with Logistics or Production or other relevant business area
* Experience and enjoyment of agile (JIRA) methods and DevOps to deliver value continuously
* Snowflake/AWS Services experience
* Technical lead experience meriting


**Who Are You**
 You add energy to the group and push the team to reach new levels. You take responsibility for your own and the team's development and are excited to drive improvements, within both processes and tools. You are a team player person who dares to take initiative and can easily adjust to different situations and working conditions. You are communicating fluently in English and have the ability to connect with users and their representatives, being able to understand requirements and analyse data. Meet users' expectations and bring clarity to unclear requirements through dialogue. In addition, a person who enjoys having fun with colleagues is much appreciated!
   

  

**WE OFFER**
 We offer an exciting work environment where you develop and maintain the skills needed to meet future challenges, flexible working hours, great team spirit, working in a global organization. If you live in Stockholm we offer direct buss between Stockholm and Södertälje.
   

  

 If the above sounds like you, don’t hesitate to apply. We are interviewing continuously
   

  

 A background check might be conducted for this position.
   

  

**FOR MORE INFORMATION**
 Please contact recruiting manager: Subhash Ghimire, e-mail: subhashchandra.ghimire@scania.com
   

  

 To apply, please use the provided link. We kindly request that applications not be submitted via email. Please note that from July 1st to August 9th, we will be unable to respond to inquiries. Thank you for your understanding.
   

  

 Scania is a world-leading provider of transport solutions. Together with our partners and customers we are driving the shift towards a sustainable transport system. In 2022, we delivered 80,238 trucks, 4,994 buses as well as 13,400 industrial and marine power systems to our customers. Net sales totalled to over SEK 170 billion, of which 21 percent were services related. Founded in 1891, Scania now operates in more than 100 countries and employs some 57,000 people. Research and development are mainly concentrated in Sweden. Production takes place in Europe and Latin America with regional product centres in Africa, Asia and Eurasia. Scania is part of TRATON GROUP. For more information visit: www.scania.com

title: Partner Manager Nordics
description:
As our Nordic Partner Manager, you will be a key player in Voyado's expansion by using your relationship-building and business skills to grow our partner network. You will be responsible for our Partners, both on the service and technology side. Together with our partner team, you will drive our network of existing partners to outstanding co-sell opportunities and find new relevant companies to join forces with.
   

  

 Your primary focus will be to recruit, onboard, and scale partners. This includes sales training, evaluation of sales opportunities via partners, and setting up business plans for new partner integrations. This is a great opportunity to develop professionally and influence Voyado’s growth strategy!
   

  

 So, who are you?
   

  

 A social chameleon who treats the delicate task of serving the few with the most exclusive relationships and at the same time manages to give the many a baseline treatment. You like to think strategically, but act hands-on and get things done. You are an entrepreneurial person with a business mindset who likes to create business opportunities. You are genuinely interested in the tech landscape around online retail and constantly seek inspiration and knowledge that you can apply in your own work.
   

  

**Skills & Background**
* Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Marketing, Communication or Economics
* Several years of experience of partner management, account management, or B2B sales within the SaaS industry, preferably within retail or e-commerce
* Ability to be your own Project manager, setting your local plan and knowing how to prioritize to achieve key targets.
* You like the idea of end-customer sales but do not necessarily need to go the whole way to closing the deal
* A plus is if you not only are tech-curious but also have some insight into technical integration projects or setup of SaaS platforms
* For this role, you need to be fluent in English and Swedish, Norwegian or Danish.


 Traveling every second week and evening representation in the local markets of Denmark and Norway is required for this role.
   

  

 What we offer
   

  

 You will be part of an extremely exciting journey in redesigning the market for personalized customer experiences. We want to make our products Europe's leading customer experience cloud in retail and e-commerce, and together with our customers, we are well on our way. We are extremely dedicated to the task, but at the same time, we ensure that everyone is doing well at work. You will have plenty of room to grow in a creative work environment where personal development is as obvious as high competence. You get to work with some of the strongest brands across the Nordics who use Voyado as a platform for their loyalty work, and your everyday life has elements of collaboration with both customer and internal Voyado teams.
   

  

 More on Voyado!
   

  

 Voyado is the ultimate solution for personalization and relevance across all channels—online and offline. Used by retailers and e-commerce companies worldwide, the Voyado customer experience cloud makes it possible for every brand to engage customers, elevate shopping experiences, and evolve their businesses.
   

  

 We are a Swedish purpose-driven company with 300+ Voyadoers where every opinion is recognized. Here, you'll get the opportunity to work self-driven with strong support that you can leverage at any time. We really care for our Voyadoers and put a lot of time and effort into keeping and nurturing our knowledge-sharing and friendly culture. We are personal and that extends into everything about Voyado, read more on what it is like to work at Voyado here.
   

  

 Ready to join the team?
   

  

 Lovely!
   

  

 It’s vacay time though, and at Voyado we really value taking time off to recharge our batteries. We hope that you are doing the same while reading this ad, perhaps you are laying in a sunbed somewhere or you just got back from a mountain bike tour. Either way, we hope you are as relaxed as us. Since we are out of office, we won’t be able to get back to you until august, but we would love for you to apply for this role if you think it’d be a great fit for you.
   

  

 Applying is super easy. Use your LinkedIn profile (or upload a resume) and answer a few click-in questions (no data entry, we promise). We´d love to get to know you and understand what makes you tick, so write a few lines about what you enjoy about your role and what would be an exciting challenge for you going forward. We are eager to get to know you and what you love to do, so be yourself and let that shine through in your application!
   

  

 Additional information
   

  

 As part of our recruitment process we conduct a background check on the final candidate. We use background checks from Scandinavian Recruitment Intelligence. Here you can read more about how a background check is done.
   

  

 Voyado is the ultimate solution for personalization and relevance across all channels—online and offline. Used by retailers and e-commerce companies worldwide, the Voyado customer experience cloud makes it possible for every brand to engage customers, elevate shopping experiences, and evolve their own businesses.

title: Java Automation lead
description:
**Automation Lead**
* Test lead architect with 10 years of technical expertise in Test Automation Agile Management and DevOps
* Strategize enterprise test automation initiatives align long term solutions including roadmap ROI tools framework approach
* Experience in designing and implementing different automation frameworks like Page Object Model Data Keyword Driven framework and BDD
* Strong knowledge of Java Programming language
